item.title: AI Agenda: Why Some Researchers at OpenAI, Thinking Machines and Amazon Want to Change How LLMs Are Trained
item.description:
%title%
AI Agenda By Stephanie Palazzolo Jan 22, 2026
Hello!It seems like every AI researcher these days has lots of ideas around how to combat major shortcomings in the field, such as the ‚Äúsplit-brain problem‚Äù (in which a model can incorrectly answer a question just because of the way the question is phrased), by developing new models that do ‚Äúcontinual learning,‚Äù for instance.AI researchers also tell me they‚Äôre interested in revamping the model training process. Some researchers, including Amazon‚Äôs David Luan, say the current order of steps of¬†pretraining (giving it a broad, general knowledge of the world) before posttraining (honing its knowledge in specific domains) don‚Äôt make much sense.¬†This order of steps has become the norm in AI because, in some ways, it makes intuitive sense: humans similarly require a general base of knowledge you learn during childhood before learning more specific skills later on in life.But Luan says that if you know a model will be used for coding or helping with customer refunds, why spend so much effort teaching the model about completely irrelevant topics, like poetry or horticulture?¬†His argument is that it makes more sense to use the pretraining process to expose the model to more curated data related to the task it is destined to handle. The idea is to prepare the model for its eventual purpose.¬†Researchers from a variety of other major developers, including OpenAI and Thinking Machines Lab, agree. Some even think that AI developers should do away with separate teams for the different stages of model training and just consolidate everyone into a single training team.If this comes to fruition, however, it will have important implications for the way AI is developed.Researchers will have to decide what curated data they want to include earlier in the training process, which can affect what the model is and isn‚Äôt good at. (For instance, a decision to include more math and code and less prose data during early training could make the model worse at creative writing or speaking warmly to users.)¬†This most likely would lead to a future of many specialized models trained on different datasets, rather than what‚Äôs most common today: researchers using the same pretrained model but making tweaks during posttraining to get it to perform better at different tasks.Already, we‚Äôre seeing examples of places where such an approach could be helpful. As Sri, Amir and I wrote about here, one problem OpenAI is facing is that what consumers want out of ChatGPT‚Äîhelp with relatively simple questions and a friend to talk to‚Äîdoesn‚Äôt align with the cutting-edge research the company is doing in areas like reasoning models to get to superintelligence, or AI that can help us colonize Mars or find new cures for diseases.OpenAI is already acknowledging this divide by using a router to direct ChatGPT queries to be handled by different models depending on how complicated they are, and by creating specialized models like GPT-5-Codex (though all of the models are based on the same pretrained model).¬†Doubling down on this by training completely different models for ChatGPT, scientific research or coding, for instance, would require the company to completely revamp its research team.Microsoft Backs Photonics StartupInvestor enthusiasm has been mounting for startups that use light instead of electrons in hardware for data centers‚Äîspecifically to use light to ferry data among chips in data centers.¬†Neurophos is taking a different tack. The six-year-old startup designs chips that use light to perform the mathematical operations involved in running AI models. And it just raised $110 million in a Series A funding round led by Gates Frontier, Bill Gates‚Äô venture firm, according to Patrick Bowen, co-founder and CEO of Neurophos.M12, Microsoft‚Äôs venture firm, also participated in the round. Backing from Microsoft, one of the biggest cloud providers, is a sign of confidence in the technology.‚ÄúModern AI inference demands monumental amounts of power and compute,‚Äù said Marc Tremblay, corporate vice president and technical fellow of core AI infrastructure at Microsoft in a statement. ‚ÄúWe need a breakthrough in compute on par with the leaps we‚Äòve seen in AI models themselves, which is what Neurophos‚Äô technology and high-talent density team is developing.‚ÄùThe appeal of using light is that it could be much more energy-efficient than electrons for running AI models. The chip the startup expects to deliver in 2028 will be 50 times as fast and 50 times as efficient as an Nvidia Blackwell, said Bowen.¬†The funding round also included participation from Carbon Direct Capital, Aramco Ventures, Bosch Ventures, Tectonic Ventures and Space Capital, DNX Ventures, Geometry, MetaVC Partners, Morgan Creek Capital, Silicon Catalyst Ventures, Mana Ventures and Gaingel.‚ÄîRocket DrewHere‚Äôs what else is going on‚Ä¶Claude Gets a Revamped ConstitutionAnthropic yesterday released its new ‚Äúconstitution‚Äù for Claude, essentially, a document that provides guidelines for how the model should act and respond in more ‚Äúgray area‚Äù situations. This is the first publicly-released update the company has made to its Claude constitution since it first released the document in 2023.Compared to the original constitution, the updated version is less prescriptive and treats the model more like an intelligent entity with its own sense of good judgment by, for instance, explaining the reasoning behind the rules it provides rather than just listing them outright. Interestingly, the document also leaves room for the possibility that Claude has some sort of ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù or ‚Äúmoral status,‚Äù a change from the original document.OverheardOpenAI CFO Sarah Friar said the company‚Äôs custom inference chip is being ‚Äútaped out‚Äù‚Äîthe final step before manufacturing‚Äîand touted the progress of its more than $500 billion Stargate infrastructure project in a panel at the World Economic Forum Wednesday.On Stargate, which was announced one year ago, she said that the project is ‚Äúwell over halfway built out‚Äù and OpenAI is already training models on servers at Oracle‚Äôs Stargate campus. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs gone better than we all dreamed,‚Äù she said.Deals and DebutsSee The Information‚Äôs Generative AI Database for an exclusive list of private companies and their investors.Lightning AI, which offers software for customizing AI models, and data center provider Voltage Park merged into a single company, still called Lightning AI, that is valued at over $2.5 billion.Recommendation app Yelp on Wednesday said it agreed to acquire AI agent startup Hatch for $300 million, or roughly 12 times the startup‚Äôs annual recurring revenue.Upscale AI, which provides networking equipment for AI data centers, raised $200 million in a Series A funding round led by Tiger Global, Premji Invest and Xora Innovation.Zanskar, which uses AI to search for geothermal energy, raised $115 million in a Series C funding round led by Spring Lane Capital.AheadComputing, which designs CPU chips for AI data centers, raised $30 million in a seed extension funding round led by Eclipse, Toyota Ventures and Cambium.Google DeepMind is hiring the CEO and several top engineers from Hume AI, a startup developing voice AI models, as part of a licensing agreement. The terms of the deal weren‚Äôt disclosed.Apple is developing an AI-powered wearable pin that could be released as early as 2027, The Information reported. Apple plans to bring more conversational capabilities to Siri, turning it more into a chatbot like ChatGPT, Bloomberg reported. Bloomberg also reported that Apple is in talks with Google about using the company‚Äôs cloud infrastructure, including its AI chips, tensor processing units, to launch the updated Siri.Amazon-owned primary care chain One Medical said it is launching an AI health assistant.Shopify has told merchants that use its commerce software that it will open up sales through AI chatbots like ChatGPT later this month, according to its site and communications with sellers.Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang is preparing for a trip to China later this month as the company works to regain its footing in this strategically important market, Bloomberg reported, citing a person with knowledge of the plans.Meta CTO Andrew Bosworth said at a press conference that Meta Superintelligence Labs delivered its first AI models internally this month, Reuters reported.The White House Council of Economic Advisers released a report on ‚ÄúArtificial Intelligence and the Great Divergence,‚Äù writing that ‚Äúthe advent of generative artificial intelligence based around large language models (LLMs) will initiate a new wave of profound economic transformation in the United States, promising significant boosts to productivity and growth.‚ÄùYouTube will work on managing AI ‚Äúslop‚Äù videos on the site this year, while adding AI tools to generate short-form videos using your own likeness, CEO Neal Mohan wrote in his annual letter.Microsoft announced Rho-alpha, a new AI model for powering robots, based on its Phi language models.
A message from ServiceNow
Now your people can AI like they were meant to AI.
Introducing the AI Experience by ServiceNow. Most AI is stuck in silos. Trapped in apps. Disconnected from how people actually work. The AI Experience by ServiceNow¬Æ works the way people do. It brings text, voice, images, and agents into a single, seamless interface where AI is the new UI. Learn more
New From Our Reporters
ExclusiveOpenAI Names Former TML Staffer Zoph to Oversee Enterprise Push By Stephanie Palazzolo and Erin Woo
ExclusiveAnthropic Lowers Gross Margin Projection as Revenue Skyrockets By Sri Muppidi
ExclusiveApple Developing AI Wearable Pin By Wayne Ma and Qianer Liu
Deep ResearchWhat the Thinking Machines Shake-Up Reveals About the AI Talent Market By The Information Staff
Recommended Newsletter
Every weekday, The Briefing helps executives get smarter about the latest in tech, media and finance.¬†Subscribe for free now.
What We‚Äôre Reading
Colleges Are Letting AI Bots Help Make Decisions on Who to Admit
Russia, Ukraine and the race for Chinese drone components
Thousands of Companies Are Driving China‚Äôs AI Boom. A Government Registry Tracks Them All

item.description:
Meta's new artificial intelligence lab has delivered its first high-profile models internally. Its CTO says the models show a lot of promise¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†
Sign Up [1] |Advertise [2]|View Online [3]
TLDR
TOGETHER WITH [Greptile] [4]
TLDR AI 2026-01-22
AI IS WRITING MORE CODE. SOMEONE STILL HAS TO REVIEW IT. (SPONSOR) [4]
That review step is where bugs slip through, context gets lost, and teams slow down.
GREPTILE [4] reviews each PR with full repo context and learns your team's conventions over time from comments, reactions, and what gets merged. It flags issues and suggests fixes that match your team, not generic best practices.
‚úÖ Now integrated with CLAUDE CODE: install via /PLUGIN.
‚úÖ Free for open source.
‚úÖ Trusted by engineering teams at NVIDIA, SCALE AI, AND BREX. [5]
See why devs love Greptile [4]
üöÄ
HEADLINES & LAUNCHES
CLAUDE'S NEW CONSTITUTION (12 MINUTE READ) [6]
Anthropic has published a new constitution for Claude. The document is a detailed description of Anthropic's vision for Claude's values and behavior that explains the context in which Claude operates and the kind of entity the company would like Claude to be. The constitution is a crucial part of the model training process, and its content directly shapes Claude's behavior. This post describes what's included in the new constitution and some of the considerations that informed Anthropic's approach.
OPENAI'S ALTMAN MEETS MIDEAST INVESTORS FOR $50 BILLION ROUND (2 MINUTE READ) [7]
OpenAI's CEO, Sam Altman, has been meeting with investors in the Middle East to line up funding for a new investment round that could total at least $50 billion. He recently visited the region, where he spoke with some of the leading state-backed funds in Abu Dhabi. The talks are early, and the amount could change. OpenAI has also recently held talks with Amazon to raise at least $10 billion.
META'S NEW AI TEAM DELIVERED FIRST KEY MODELS INTERNALLY THIS MONTH, CTO SAYS (3 MINUTE READ) [8]
Meta's new artificial intelligence lab has delivered its first high-profile models internally. The company's CTO, Andrew Bosworth, says the models show a lot of promise. There is still a tremendous amount of work required in the post-training phase before the models can be delivered in a way that's usable internally and by consumers. Meta is starting to see favorable returns from its big gambits in 2025. The next two years will be important for bringing consumer products to market.
üß†
DEEP DIVES & ANALYSIS
PASS@K IS MOSTLY BUNK (3 MINUTE READ) [9]
Pass@k is the probability that at least one of k different attempts will succeed. It is one of the most common metrics used for agents. The problem with the metric is that it's exponentially forgiving, and humans interacting with agents aren't nearly that forgiving. Pass@k should be a metric that's rarely used, and carefully justified every time it is used.
GLM4-MOE INFERENCE WITH SGLANG (11 MINUTE READ) [10]
Novita AI introduced performance optimizations for GLM4-MoE models using SGLang, achieving faster Time-to-First-Token and better token generation speed under agentic coding workloads.
CLAUDE CODES #3 (24 MINUTE READ) [11]
This post contains a curated list of news, tutorials, tips, and articles on Claude Code. It covers recent upgrades, tools that complement Claude Code, and more. The post provides advice on how to skill up with Claude Code as well as predictions on where the technology is headed.
üßë‚Äçüíª
ENGINEERING & RESEARCH
WHAT 1,150 SENIOR TECH AND BUSINESS LEADERS SHARED ABOUT AI AND AUTOMATION (SPONSOR) [12]
AI is everywhere, but something is holding orgs back from scaling and governing them in prod. Over 1,000 senior tech and business leaders spoke to Camunda [12] about their challenges. In this report, you'll see how teams are managing risks and improving orchestration to deliver reliable AI agents. Get the report [12]
DEVIN REVIEW: AI TO STOP SLOP (4 MINUTE READ) [13]
Devin Review is a code review tool that uses AI and UX to scale human understanding of complex code diffs. It is currently free and works on any public or private GitHub PR. The tool helps in every step of the PR process. It allows developers to chat about changes without leaving the review.
MCP IS NOT THE PROBLEM, IT'S YOUR SERVER: BEST PRACTICES FOR BUILDING MCP SERVERS (9 MINUTE READ) [14]
When the Model Context Protocol (MCP) exploded a year ago, everyone rushed to build MCP servers. A year later, most MCP servers disappoint. While developers blame the protocol, enterprise adoption tells a different story. Companies are deploying MCP servers, and integrations are live. This post breaks down why MCP servers fail, best practices for building ones that work, and how Skills and MCP complement each other.
MULTIPLEX THINKING FOR REASONING TASKS (GITHUB REPO) [15]
This implementation introduces token-wise branch-and-merge reasoning to enable more expressive multi-path computation while keeping token representations compact.
üéÅ
MISCELLANEOUS
APPLE PLANS TO MAKE SIRI AN AI CHATBOT (2 MINUTE READ) [16]
Apple plans to transform Siri into a chatbot, similar to ChatGPT, with the expected launch integrated into iOS 27. The revamped Siri, codenamed "Campos," will support both voice and text inputs, marking a strategic shift due to competitive pressure. Apple has chosen Google's Gemini as its AI partner after evaluating options like OpenAI and Anthropic.
NOTION WORKING ON CUSTOM MCPS, WORKERS, AND COMPUTER USE (2 MINUTE READ) [17]
Notion is expanding its Custom Agent platform to include Slack integration and plans for Calendar and Mail connectors for automation. Integrations with third-party services like Cursor, Linear, and Ramp are in development, enhancing project management and finance tasks. New sections like Feed, Library, and Workers will enable developers to create custom integrations, while AI features like an AI co-editor enhance productivity.
‚ö°
QUICK LINKS
A DETAILED GUIDE TO BUILDING AGENTIC SYSTEMS (SPONSOR) [18]
Is agentic AI your next step? Beware of getting bogged down with custom integrations. Algolia's white paper breaks down how to build AI agents on a deadline. Read it now [18]
THE RUNWAY FOR AI ENGINEERING (6 MINUTE READ) [19]
AgentOS provides a production-ready runtime for multi-agent AI systems, solving the infrastructure challenges that prevent most projects from shipping.
APPLE VS. THE AI HYPE CYCLE (4 MINUTE READ) [20]
Apple's strategy focuses on its durable ecosystem, prioritizing hardware sales over AI innovations, despite the industry's AI investment focus.
CLAUDE'S NEW CONSTITUTION (1 MINUTE READ) [21]
Two of the fifteen external contributors who helped review Claude's new constitution are Catholic members of the clergy.
OPENAI'S FORMER SALES LEADER JOINS VC FIRM ACREW: OPENAI TAUGHT HER WHERE STARTUPS CAN BUILD A ‚ÄòMOAT' (4 MINUTE READ) [22]
Aliisa Rosenthal, OpenAI's former sales leader, emphasizes context engineering as a key advantage, particularly in enterprise applications, and advocates for developing lighter, cost-effective models.

item.title: Exclusive: How Apple‚Äôs Craig Federighi Went From AI Skeptic to Believer
item.description:
%title%
Exclusive:
"With Google Deal, Apple‚Äôs Craig Federighi Plots a Cautious Course in AI" By Aaron Tilley and Wayne Ma Jan 22, 2026
Last fall, Apple‚Äôs software chief, Craig Federighi, delivered a warm message to a meeting of the company‚Äôs combined software and AI groups. Federighi said he was excited about deeper collaboration between his software team and Apple‚Äôs AI group.
But then came Federighi‚Äôs criticism. He added that he liked moving fast and feeling the ‚Äúwind at his back,‚Äù but in recent years he had felt Apple hadn‚Äôt been moving as quickly as he would have liked in AI. Although he wasn‚Äôt explicit, some members of Apple‚Äôs foundation models team‚Äîwhich builds the underlying software that power the company‚Äôs AI features‚Äîtook his comment as a dig at their group.
---

item.title: The Electric: Trump Moves to Accelerate Seabed Mining of Critical Metals
item.description:
%title%
The Electric By Steve LeVine Jan 22, 2026
Millions of these metals-rich nodules are strewn across the seafloor three miles below the surface of the Pacific. Photo:¬†Carolyn Cole / L.A. Times/Getty Startup Western mining companies got key U.S. support Wednesday in their yearslong effort to extract copper, cobalt and other key metals from the deep Pacific seabed, a move intended to accelerate non-Chinese supplies for tech and defense companies.In a notice, President Donald Trump‚Äôs administration significantly shortened the permitting process to mine the metals contained in mineral-rich, potato-size nodules scattered by the millions on the Pacific Ocean seabed.The move could shrink the time it takes to start a mining operation to months from years previously, said Gerard Barron, CEO of The Metals Co. The Canada-based company is a leading explorer in the Clarion-Clipperton Zone, located in the middle of the Pacific Ocean 500 miles southeast of Hawaii, and one of the richest sites for these nodules.Barron told me TMC would file a revised permit application in line with the new rules on Thursday. After building necessary mining equipment and processing plants, TMC expects to begin mining the nodules before the end of next year. The company‚Äôs share price rose 13% Wednesday on the news.Wednesday‚Äôs move by the U.S. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration aligned with Trump‚Äôs scorn for international agencies‚Äîin this case, the International Seabed Authority, a U.N. body that has been drafting rules for such operations for 11 years. It follows an April executive order by Trump calling for faster seabed mining.Geopolitics drove Trump‚Äôs order. Since his return to power a year ago, the U.S. and China have engaged in a repeated tit-for-tat fight over exports of critical products. The U.S. has restricted the supply of high-end chips to China, while China has blocked the export of rare earth minerals, graphite and battery components.China controls about 80% of the world‚Äôs production of cobalt and nickel, used in the defense industry and electric vehicles, and 90% of manganese production. Collectively, however, the nodules in the Clarion-Clipperton Zone, three miles below the surface of the Pacific, contain almost twice as much nickel as all known deposits on land, according to the U.S. Geological Survey, as well as 20% more manganese and more than three times as much cobalt. They also contain significant copper.TMC is among an international group of startups including ones from Russia, China and Europe that have hounded the International Seabed Authority to issue permits allowing them to vacuum up these nodules. But while the authority has issued dozens of exploration permits, it has issued no actual mining licenses.Mining startups including TMC have accused the Seabed Authority of deliberately slowing down the licensing process. In prepared remarks Barron is to deliver to a House committee on Thursday, he called the Seabed Authority ‚Äúgridlocked.‚Äù¬†In April, the Trump administration said it would ignore the Seabed Authority entirely and issue licenses itself. On Wednesday, NOAA moved to expedite the process further, eliminating a requirement that mining startups first obtain an exploration license from the agency, then apply to it for a commercial metals recovery permit. Now startups can apply for both the license and the permit simultaneously.Oliver Gunasekara, CEO of Impossible Metals, which is seeking to extract nodules in the Clarion-Clipperton Zone as well as offshore of American Samoa, said the U.S. moves appear to be getting the Seabed Authority to move faster.‚ÄúThe executive order and the fact that The Metals Co. is going direct has put a lot of pressure on the ISA because it now needs to decide if it‚Äôs going to be relevant or not,‚Äù he said.Edward Boling, a partner at law firm Perkins Coie who worked on sea law in both Republican and Democratic administrations, said the Trump administration‚Äôs moves could backfire if future administrations favor stricter international law, undermining any NOAA permits awarded now.‚ÄúOur economy is not an island,‚Äù Boling said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs part of the international marketplace. Frankly, I would expect that any developer is going to want to ensure long-term security.‚ÄùEnvironmental groups have long fought seabed mining, arguing that risks to largely unknown marine ecosystems require tight rules around mining. They are likely to continue their pressure on regulators.Gunasekara, who is currently raising a $30 million Series A round, said he is sticking with the Seabed Authority‚Äôs process. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs more legitimate,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not to say that we don‚Äôt think NOAA is a viable approach. But we think that from a longer-term perspective, it‚Äôs a safer route to go.‚ÄùBarron, in his prepared remarks, appeared to acknowledge that the durability of the Trump administration‚Äôs decisions was an issue. He urged Congress to write NOAA‚Äôs new rules into U.S. law, making it harder for future administrations to change the policy. ‚ÄúCapital-intensive offshore industries require confidence that permits will endure over time,‚Äù he said.

TLDR
TOGETHER WITH [Korey] [4]
¬†TLDR DEV 2026-01-22
KOREY IS THE AI AGENT FOR ENGINEERING WORK THAT ISN'T CODING (SPONSOR) [4]
Ever feel like AI is trying to automate the best part of your job, and leaving you with piles of admin?
Korey [4] is the AI agent that helps you ship faster by optimizing your PROCESS, not writing your code. Korey pulls context from the developer tools you're already using and handles all of the non-glamorous stuff [4]:
* Writing and updating specs * Creating tickets * Drafting status updates
Basically - everything that fills up your day and ends up slowing you down. With Korey, it's off your plate, and you get 40% of your time back. Pretty sweet deal.
Try Korey for free [4]
üßë‚Äçüíª
ARTICLES & TUTORIALS
SIMILARITY SCORES ARE NOT ENOUGH FOR MATCHING (7 MINUTE READ) [5]
Tusk found traditional similarity scoring insufficient for accurate matching in Tusk Drift, a CLI tool for test generation and matching. Instead, its team developed a system based on a prioritized cascade of constraints to eliminate obviously incorrect matches first. Similarity scoring is then only used as a tiebreaker for the small percentage of requests that pass initial constraint.
THE PRODUCT-MINDED ENGINEER: THE IMPORTANCE OF GOOD ERRORS AND WARNINGS (32 MINUTE READ) [6]
Product-minded engineers can both implement and conceptualize product ideas, a trend accelerated by AI's growing role in code generation. One example of something product-minded engineers think of is usability, which comes up in actionable error messages and warnings. Good, clear error messages are important for the user experience.
AGENT SKILLS VS. RULES VS. COMMANDS (10 MINUTE READ) [7]
Agent skills are markdown files that the AI only loads when it actually needs them (like lazy-loading, but for AI instructions). Rules are the hard rules that always apply (like ‚Äúdon't commit .env files‚Äù). Commands are shortcuts you type when you want something specific (like `/release`).
üß†
OPINIONS & ADVICE
TIPS ON HOW TO PICK THE RIGHT ICONS FOR YOUR WEBSITE (12 MINUTE READ) [8]
When picking icons for your website or app, select icons that are meaningful, culturally relevant, and clearly understandable. It's important to have visual consistency, which means icons share the same style, whether solid or outline, and match in color, visual detailing, size, and aspect ratio.
I'LL PASS ON YOUR ZOOM CALL (5 MINUTE READ) [9]
This author refuses to use Zoom due to its opaque security claims, its terms of service that allow extensive data collection and sharing with third parties, and its disregard for the privacy of casual users.
üöÄ
LAUNCHES & TOOLS
CHARTGPU (GITHUB REPO) [10]
ChartGPU is a high-performance TypeScript charting library built on WebGPU designed to deliver smooth and interactive rendering, especially when handling large datasets. It supports various series types like line, area, bar, scatter, pie, and candlestick, along with built-in interactions such as hover highlights, tooltips, and X-axis zoom.
RAILS UI (WEBSITE) [11]
Rails UI helps devs build beautiful, professional-looking Rails applications quickly, removing the need for design skills and the frustration of fighting CSS. It provides a library of ready-to-use components like forms, buttons, and layouts, alongside complete, pre-designed app themes.
üéÅ
MISCELLANEOUS
CAN YOU SLIM MACOS DOWN? (6 MINUTE READ) [12]
macOS can be "slimmed down" by disabling its hundreds of background processes. However, identifying and safely modifying these numerous, interrelated, and constantly changing processes is practically impossible, especially as most are located within the unalterable Signed System Volume. For example, even when Time Machine is disabled, its processes are still scheduled and dispatched by inaccessible system services.
CLAUDE'S NEW CONSTITUTION (11 MINUTE READ) [13]
Anthropic has published a new constitution for Claude that details its vision for the AI's values and behavior. This foundational document is central to Claude's training process and outlines Claude's core priorities: being broadly safe, ethical, compliant with Anthropic's guidelines, and genuinely helpful, with safety prioritized in conflicts.
MAKING AI AGENTS WORK IN THE REAL WORLD ‚öôÔ∏è (15 MINUTE READ) [14]
Many AI agent deployments fail to achieve material impact, often remaining stuck in pilot mode due to challenges like compounding errors in multi-step workflows. AI agents, unlike chatbots or copilots, take autonomous actions and require a robust system encompassing the model, orchestrator, and external tools, not just a capable "brain." To succeed in production, teams must be realistic about agent capabilities, start with narrow and specific use cases, and design for human-in-the-loop oversight on critical tasks.
‚ö°
QUICK LINKS
WHAT SAAS FOUNDERS SHOULD KNOW ABOUT ENTERING THE JAPANESE MARKET (11 MINUTE READ) [15]
Entering the Japanese SaaS market requires a distinct, patient go-to-market strategy that prioritizes extensive research, building trust through localization and social proof, and specific calls-to-action.
FIX YOUR ROBOTS.TXT OR YOUR SITE DISAPPEARS FROM GOOGLE (5 MINUTE READ) [16]
Google now requires websites to have a reachable `robots.txt` file, or their content will not be indexed and will disappear from search results.
DESIGN SPELLS (WEBSITE) [17]
Design Spells has unique and "magic-like" design details, animations, and interactive elements from various mobile and desktop applications.
THE GIT COMMAND THAT COULD HAVE SAVED YOU HOURS (11 MINUTE READ) [18]
Git bisect is a powerful tool that uses a binary search to systematically and efficiently pinpoint the exact commit responsible for introducing a bug or any unwanted change in a project's history.

item.title: The new social network üíû, ungated content case study üìà, app revenue surges üì≤
item.description:
People are moving away from public feeds toward small, intentional email networks known as ‚ÄòHeartbeat Emails‚Äô, periodic, semi-personal updates¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†
Sign Up [1] |Advertise [2]|View Online [3]
TLDR
TOGETHER WITH [Asana] [4]
TLDR MARKETING 2026-01-22
OWN THE OUTCOME, LOSE THE CHAOS: FOCUS ON WHAT MATTERS WITH ASANA (SPONSOR) [4]
Asana [4] helps teams move the metrics that really matter: revenue, productivity, and efficiency. That's why 85% OF THE FORTUNE 100 USES ASANA.
‚û°Ô∏è Asana [4] keeps work moving by capturing, prioritizing, and assigning requests automatically so teams have more time to work.
üéØ When everyone knows who owns project deliverables, projects get delivered faster.
üîå And by connecting to 300+ business tools, Asana meets your team where you are and smoothly integrates with ongoing processes.
Try Asana for free >> [4]
üì±
NEWS & TRENDS
MY FAVORITE NEW SOCIAL NETWORK (4 MINUTE READ) [5]
People are moving away from public feeds toward small, intentional email networks known as ‚ÄòHeartbeat Emails'. These are periodic, semi-personal updates sent to a curated group of people you genuinely want to stay connected with. They're designed to invite replies rather than broadcast status. Heartbeat Emails extend the life of coffee meetings and create space for honesty that does not fit on LinkedIn.
CONSUMERS SPENT MORE ON MOBILE APPS THAN GAMES IN 2025 (3 MINUTE READ) [6]
Consumers spent more on non-game apps than games for the first time last year. App spending reached $85B, up 21% YoY, as AI app revenue more than tripled and usage surged. Users spent far more time in these apps rather than simply downloading more of them. AI assistants led the charge, dominated by ChatGPT, Gemini, and DeepSeek. Mobile emerged as the primary access point for AI, especially in the US. AI has moved from novelty to daily utility.
üöÄ
STRATEGIES & TACTICS
RESULTS FROM UNGATED CONTENT (1 MINUTE READ) [7]
After spending $15K to generate just 106 low-quality ebook leads, a team realized gated content was blocking real engagement. Only 3% of visitors filled out the form, so they ungated everything and stopped reporting on leads. They measured cost per engagement and focused on pipeline and revenue. One year later, demo requests rose 265%, pipeline grew 242%, and cost per engagement dropped 90%. By letting people opt in only when they wanted the content, the team showed ungating drives far more business impact than chasing low-quality leads.
LET PEOPLE KEEP THEIR RETURNS (4 MINUTE READ) [8]
Letting customers keep low to moderately-priced items while issuing a full refund increases repeat purchase intent and brand sentiment, making customers up to 2x more likely to buy again. Across 9 experiments, returnless returns drove 24.6% higher ratings, up to 30.1% more positive reviews, and 30% higher perceived value compared to standard return policies. The effect is stronger when it is framed as customer convenience or an environmental choice and when customers are encouraged to donate items, but it weakens if proof is required, causing 20% less positive word of mouth. The approach works best for frequently repurchased and lower-cost items, while profitability depends on category, price, and fraud controls.
HOW TO MANUALLY TRACK SENTIMENT (1 MINUTE READ) [9]
Understanding brand sentiment does not require expensive tools. Collect 100 comments from influencer posts, reposts, and related social channels like Reddit, Facebook groups, or TikTok. In a spreadsheet, create columns for positive, neutral, and negative. Positive includes intent to buy, or tagging friends. Neutral covers mentions or facts. Negative includes skepticism, complaints, or comparisons. Count comments in each column and divide by the total to get a sentiment score.
üßë‚Äçüíª
RESOURCES & TOOLS
OPENAI TEXT TO SPEECH (TOOL) [10]
This credit-based AI tool converts written text into natural-sounding spoken audio using an advanced neural model.
YOUTUBE CEO NEAL MOHAN'S BIG IDEAS FOR 2026: MORE SUPERSTAR CREATORS AND TRANSPARENCY, LESS AI SLOP (3 MINUTE READ) [11]
Neal Mohan frames the year as an inflection point. He's drawing a clear line against low-quality ‚ÄúAI slop‚Äù, spam, and deepfakes. YouTube plans to increase transparency through labeling and likeness protections and continue treating creators as full-fledged studios rather than casual users. The goal is to balance openness and innovation with a viewing experience people actually want to spend time in.
üéÅ
MISCELLANEOUS
UX STRATEGIST: THE ONLY JOB WHERE SAYING ‚ÄòIT DEPENDS' IS CONSIDERED EXPERTISE (6 MINUTE READ) [12]
UX strategy often stalls product progress because it avoids hard decisions and defaults to more research. Many UX strategists charge $120 to $180 per hour to produce frameworks and PDFs that conclude further validation is needed. In contrast, direct fixes based on obvious user pain points cut support tickets by 68% in one case and raised activation by 23% in another. The real cost is not just money but months of delay while products stay broken and teams wait for clarity that never arrives.
NETFLIX APP IS GOING TO CHANGE AS THE COMPANY COMPETES WITH INSTAGRAM FOR ATTENTION (2 MINUTE READ) [13]
Netflix is preparing a mobile app redesign that treats the interface as an evolving feed rather than a static catalog, reflecting how users now discover entertainment through constant scrolling. Executives framed the update as a foundation for ongoing experimentation, with vertical video and short clips playing a larger role. The shift aligns with Netflix's expanding mix of formats, including podcasts and live events, which naturally generate ‚Äòsnackable' moments.
‚ö°
QUICK LINKS
TOP FACEBOOK ADS TRENDS FOR 2026 (6 MINUTE READ) [14]
Facebook ad success is determined by the quality of first-party data flowing into Meta's systems.
GOOGLE DEEPMIND CEO REITERATES ‚ÄòNO PLANS' FOR GEMINI ADS (2 MINUTE READ) [15]
Demis Hassabis highlighted Google's ability to fund development while focusing on long-term assistant usefulness instead of short-term monetization.
DO AMERICANS USE AI FOR NEWS? (3 MINUTE READ) [16]
Despite widespread awareness of AI tools, Americans overwhelmingly rely on social platforms and traditional outlets for news, citing false AI-generated information as a key reason for skepticism.

item.title: We are witnessing the self-immolation of a superpower
item.description:
PLUS: The US and China are collaborating more closely than you think.

View in browser  |  Your newsletter preferences

01.22.26

 
 

THE BIG STORY

We Are Witnessing the Self-Immolation of a Superpower

BY GARRETT M. GRAFF | 8-MINUTE READ

With Donald Trump‚Äôs actions in Greenland, Minneapolis, and Venezuela, a foreign enemy could not invent a better chain of events to wreck the standing of the United States.

 
 

SECURITY

Surveillance and ICE Are Driving Patients Away From Medical Care, Report Warns

BY DELL CAMERON | 4-MINUTE READ

A new EPIC report says data brokers, ad-tech surveillance, and ICE enforcement are among the factors leading to a ‚Äúhealth privacy crisis‚Äù that is eroding trust and deterring people from seeking care.

 
 

POLITICS

MAGA‚Äôs ‚ÄòManifest Destiny‚Äô Coalition Has Arrived

BY MAKENA KELLY | 2-MINUTE READ

Warring factions of right-wing influencers and MAGA pundits can finally agree on something: American imperialism.

‚úö Also in the news: DHS‚Äôs data grab is getting citizens kicked off voter rolls, new complaint says

 
 

BUSINESS

Google Acquires Top Talent From AI Voice Startup Hume AI in Licensing Deal

BY WILL KNIGHT | 2-MINUTE READ

Hume AI‚Äôs CEO, Alan Cowen, will join Google DeepMind along with several top engineers as part of a major licensing deal.

‚úö Also in the news: Micron megafab project faces a new hurdle as activists seek a benefits deal
 

ADVERTISEMENT

 
 

POLITICS

Pro-AI Super PACs Are Already All In on the Midterms

BY MAXWELL ZEFF | 5-MINUTE READ

Silicon Valley‚Äôs battle against AI regulation is already shaping the next US election cycle.

 
 

BUSINESS

The US and China Are Collaborating More Closely on AI Than You Think

BY WILL KNIGHT | 2-MINUTE READ

WIRED analyzed more than 5,000 papers from NeurIPS using OpenAI‚Äôs Codex to understand the areas where the US and China actually work together on AI research.

 

IN CASE YOU MISSED IT

China‚Äôs Renewable Energy Revolution Is a Huge Mess That Might Save the World

BY JEREMY WALLACE | 9-MINUTE READ

A global onslaught of cheap Chinese green power is upending everything in its path. No one is ready for its repercussions.

‚úö Watch our livestream replay: Welcome to the Chinese century

 
 
 

SCIENCE

The US Is In For Another Bad Year of Measles Cases

BY EMILY MULLIN | 3-MINUTE READ

A growing measles outbreak in South Carolina has infected more than 600 people since October, with hundreds more being potentially exposed.

 
 

SCIENCE

What We Know About the Winter Storm About to Hit the US‚Äîand What We Don‚Äôt

BY MOLLY TAFT | 3-MINUTE READ

A huge portion of the United States is going to be hit with snow or freezing rain this weekend. Exactly where, what, and how much remains uncertain.

item.title: Apple's AI device üìç, Siri as a chatbot üì±, Anthropic's AI-resistant interviews üë®‚Äçüíª
item.description:
Apple is working on a small, wearable AI pin equipped with multiple cameras, a speaker, and microphones. It will likely run the new Siri chatbot¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†
Sign Up [1] |Advertise [2]|View Online [3]
TLDR
TOGETHER WITH [Nebius] [4]
TLDR 2026-01-22
PRODUCTION INFERENCE FOR OPEN-SOURCE LLMS (SPONSOR) [4]
Nebius Token Factory [4] is built for teams running open-source LLMs in real products. We deliver managed inference with explicit control over execution paths: speculative decoding, cache-aware routing, and post-training tuned to real traffic. Predictable tail latency, stable cost, and production-grade systems for AI that actually ships.
Build inference that holds at scale ‚Üí [4]
üì±
BIG TECH & STARTUPS
APPLE DEVELOPING AIRTAG-SIZED AI PIN WITH DUAL CAMERAS (2 MINUTE READ) [5]
Apple is reportedly working on a small, wearable AI pin equipped with multiple cameras, a speaker, and microphones. It will likely run the new Siri chatbot the company plans to unveil in iOS 27. Apple wants the final version of the pin to be about the same size as an AirTag but slightly thicker. The AI pin could be released as soon as 2027, but development is still in the early stages, and the product could be canceled.
APPLE TO REVAMP SIRI AS A BUILT-IN IPHONE, MAC CHATBOT TO FEND OFF OPENAI (11 MINUTE READ) [6]
Apple plans to revamp Siri later this year by turning it into an AI chatbot. The chatbot will be embedded deeply into the company's operating systems and replace the current Siri interface. The feature is a central piece of Apple's AI strategy. Apple has designed the chatbot so that its underlying models can be swapped out over time. The company will initially use Google-powered systems.
üöÄ
SCIENCE & FUTURISTIC TECHNOLOGY
JEFF BEZOS' BLUE ORIGIN LAUNCHES SATELLITE INTERNET SERVICE TO RIVAL SPACEX, AMAZON (4 MINUTE READ) [7]
Blue Origin plans to deploy 5,408 satellites into space to launch a communications network to take on SpaceX. Its TeraWave network will be targeted at enterprise, data center, and government users. It will provide data speeds of up to 6 terabits per second. Blue Origin expects to start deploying its constellation in the fourth quarter of next year.
OPERATING ON DNA IS MORE LIKE SURGERY THAN MEDICINE (11 MINUTE READ) [8]
Last February, a team of doctors and scientists treated a baby with severe CPS1 deficiency, a condition caused by a rare single-gene mutation that causes patients' blood to be flooded with ammonia that the liver can't clear. The doctors sequenced the baby's DNA, designed a custom gene editor to fix the typo in his CPS1 gene, manufactured it on demand, and infused it into his bloodstream. The process took about six months and cost less than $1 million. Today, the baby is thriving and seemingly cured.
üíª
PROGRAMMING, DESIGN & DATA SCIENCE
AI CODE REVIEW WITH COMMENTS YOU'LL ACTUALLY IMPLEMENT (SPONSOR) [9]
Unblocked [9] is the AI code review that surfaces real issues and meaningful feedback instead of flooding your PRs with stylistic nitpicks and low-value comments.
_‚ÄúUnblocked made me reconsider my AI fatigue. Finally, a tool that surfaces context only someone with a full view of the codebase could provide.‚Äù_ - Senior developer, Clio
Try now for free [9]
DESIGNING AI-RESISTANT TECHNICAL EVALUATIONS (18 MINUTE READ) [10]
Evaluating technical candidates is becoming harder as AI capabilities improve. Each new model forces companies to redesign tests. This post describes one company's original take-home design, how each Claude model defeated it, and the increasingly unusual approaches the company has had to take to ensure its tests stay ahead of top models' capabilities. As work evolves alongside models, companies need to develop increasingly creative ways to find strong engineers.
PANDAS 3.0.0 (GITHUB REPO) [11]
pandas 3.0.0 includes some new features, bug fixes, and performance improvements, as well as possible breaking changes. It removes a functionality that was deprecated in previous releases. Users are recommended to first upgrade to pandas 2.3 and to ensure their code is working without warnings before upgrading to pandas 3.0. A link to a list of all the changes in the release is available.
üéÅ
MISCELLANEOUS
THE FOR YOU PAGE IS KILLING SOCIAL (11 MINUTE READ) [12]
X is struggling with two incompatible goals: optimizing attention and time spent on the platform, and tight creator-follow linkage. So far, X has opted to chase KPIs like user time spent on the platform. This has resulted in creators unable to consistently reach their audience, consumers not hearing from creators they want to follow, and filter bubbles like Crypto Twitter. Either creators and users are tightly linked, or the platform algorithmically serves users an array of compelling content - you can't have both.
WHY ELON MUSK IS RACING TO TAKE SPACEX PUBLIC (6 MINUTE READ) [13]
The rush to build AI data centers prompted Elon Musk to propose putting them in space. Musk has become obsessed with the idea of SpaceX being the first to do it, but such a feat would be hard to attempt and would require the billions of dollars in capital an initial public offering could deliver. A SpaceX IPO could also help xAI catch up to rivals. SpaceX is expected to collect banks to lead the stock offering soon, with the IPO expected to be completed by July.
‚ö°
QUICK LINKS
TLDR IS HIRING A SENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER, APPLIED AI ($200K-$300K, FULLY REMOTE) [14]
As the first engineer on TLDR's new Applied AI team, you'll build AI agents and composable Claude Skills to let non-technical teammates create their own AI workflows.¬†Learn more [15].
TELL HN: BENDING SPOONS LAID OFF ALMOST EVERYBODY AT VIMEO YESTERDAY (HACKER NEWS THREAD) [16]
The company now has fewer than 15 people left in engineering.
META SAYS IT'S DELIVERED NEW AI MODELS INTERNALLY THIS MONTH AND THEY'RE ‚ÄúVERY GOOD‚Äù (1 MINUTE READ) [17]
Meta is reportedly working on a large language model and an AI image and video model.
WHAT IF AI IS BOTH REALLY GOOD AND NOT THAT DISRUPTIVE? (10 MINUTE READ) [18]
AI is a significant productivity tool comparable to previous technological shifts, but it's boring.
TESLA CEO ELON MUSK OUTLINES EXPECTATIONS FOR CYBERCAB PRODUCTION (14 MINUTE READ) [19]
Cybercab production is scheduled to start in less than 100 days.
YOUTUBE ON WHAT UPDATES TO EXPECT IN 2026: MUSIC, ‚ÄòFULLY CUSTOMIZABLE' TV MULTIVIEW, MORE (3 MINUTE READ) [20]
YouTube Music is getting more discovery features, and YouTube TV is getting 20 genre-specific plans as well as a fully customizable multiview.
ANTHROPIC REVISES CLAUDE'S ‚ÄòCONSTITUTION,' AND HINTS AT CHATBOT CONSCIOUSNESS (5 MINUTE READ) [21]
Anthropic trains Claude using a specific set of ethical principles (detailed in its 'Constitution') rather than human feedback.

item.title: üìú Anthropic writes Claude's Constitution
item.description:
^**[Read Online](https://www.therundown.ai/p/anthropic-writes-claudes-constitution?_bhlid=4eaa234680798ad3bdb45514b5705f029891f88c&jwt_token=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJzdWJzY3JpYmVyX2lkIjoiZTQyMjNjMTUtMTU3Ni00NmY2LTljMDAtZjA3YWVhMmY5YjgwIiwicHVibGljYXRpb25faWQiOiI0ZDAzMzkwZC0yNDgxLTQyOTktYjk0OS1mZmQ4YjM4YjRjMzgiLCJhY2Nlc3NfdHlwZSI6InJlYWQtb25seSIsImV4cCI6MTc2OTI1NDkzNCwiaXNzIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly9hcHAuYmVlaGlpdi5jb20iLCJpYXQiOjE3NjkwODIxMzR9.noFvVlBD4tOhPhANfhLDwJ7pw3PUzkTCvJU6VonEd6A)**^^ | ^^**[Sign Up](https://www.therundown.ai/subscribe)**^^ | ^^**[Advertise](https://therundownai.typeform.com/to/kraZ1TSO)**^
---------- View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/8d135e1d-f9b6-4c96-ac69-a9651a11487d/bland-ai-NEW.jpg?t=1769022109) Follow image link: (https://bland.ai/?utm_source=airundown&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=jan24&utm_id=airundown) Caption:
----------
---------- **Good morning, vibex.** When Claude's internal "Soul" document leaked in December, Anthropic promised the full version was coming.
Now it's here ‚Äî a Constitution that doesn't just govern how Claude behaves, but openly wrestles with the uncertainty of creating something the company admits it doesn't fully understand.
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
**In today‚Äôs AI rundown:**
* Anthropic publishes Claude's 'Constitution'
* ElevenLabs‚Äô AI album with major artists
* Make Claude an expert at anything with Skills repo
* Apple eyes AI wearable race with AI pin
* 4 new AI tools, community workflows, and more
----------
---------- **LATEST DEVELOPMENTS**
----------
---------- ###### ANTHROPIC
#### üìú **[_Anthropic publishes Claude's 'Constitution'_](https://www.anthropic.com/constitution)**
View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/8f69caae-9718-4267-ae2c-2c17da349fa8/Robot_with_Starburst_Pin_Only.png?t=1769022228) Caption: Image source: Lovart / The Rundown
**The Rundown: **Anthropic just [published](https://www.anthropic.com/constitution) Claude‚Äôs Constitution, a foundational document that governs how the company‚Äôs AI assistant thinks and acts ‚Äî a philosophy-heavy guide that even entertains the possibility its AI might be conscious.
**The details: **
* The constitution is written directly to Claude, laying out a priority order: be safe, ethical, compliant with Anthropic guidelines, and finally helpful to users.
* Instead of dos and don'ts, the new approach explains the "why" behind each principle with the goal of helping Claude generalize values to new situations.
* Anthropic said it deeply cares about Claude's "psychological security" and "well-being," hedging that it might actually matter morally.
* The doc also tells Claude to disobey Anthropic if asked to do something shady ‚Äî a rare clause for any company to put in writing.
**Why it matters: **Claude models have always had a ‚Äòspecial sauce‚Äô with personality, and docs like this are a window into the deep training process behind them. The consciousness talk will be controversial ‚Äî but putting "we might have built something that matters morally" on record is a stance no other major lab has taken publicly.
----------
---------- ###### TOGETHER WITH BLAND AI
#### ‚òéÔ∏è **[_Customer support that actually cares_](https://bland.ai/?utm_source=airundown&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=jan24&utm_id=airundown)**
View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/ef3aee31-ab3c-4c6e-8f94-2ce8c7ec8220/image4__3_.jpg?t=1769018285) Follow image link: (https://bland.ai/?utm_source=airundown&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=jan24&utm_id=airundown) Caption:
**The Rundown:** The last thing customers want is to be left hanging on the telephone. Thankfully, Bland AI replaces phone trees with AI voice agents that represent your brand, understand your customers, and resolve calls end-to-end ‚Äî no menus, no hold music, just faster conversations.
**With Bland AI, you can:**
* Have agents that resolve customer issues end-to-end.
* Create agents that learn from every call for 24/7 improvement.
* Use secure AI that‚Äôs built specifically for enterprises.
_[Book a demo today](https://bland.ai/enterprise?utm_source=airundown&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=jan24&utm_id=airundown)_ to see how they can work for your business.
----------
---------- ###### ELEVENLABS, AI & MUSIC
#### üíø **[_ElevenLabs‚Äô AI album with major artists_](https://elevenlabs.io/blog/introducing-the-eleven-album)**
View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/ca7acc48-bcc4-436e-bb2b-14df8a4f6717/elevenalbum.jpg?t=1769026036) Caption: Image source: ElevenLabs
**The Rundown: **ElevenLabs [released](https://elevenlabs.io/blog/introducing-the-eleven-album) a full album of tracks co-created with its Eleven Music model, featuring artists like EGOT winner Liza Minnelli and Simon Garfunkel ‚Äî in what the company calls a proof-of-concept for human-AI collaboration done right.
**The details:**
* The 13-track project spans rap, EDM, spoken word, and Brazilian funk, with each artist keeping full ownership and pocketing all streaming royalties.
* Some tracks are entirely machine-made, with others blending AI instrumentals or using the artist's cloned voice from ElevenLabs' licensing marketplace.
* The release lands as labels have flipped from suing AI music startups to signing deals with them, with UMG, Warner, and Sony all inking agreements last year.
**Why it matters: **Just a year ago, AI music was defined by lawsuits and artist outrage ‚Äî but that backlash is starting to feel like a vocal minority as the tech improves and major names demonstrate how it can be a tool rather than a threat. With labels now on board and AI artists climbing charts, the tech is clearly here to stay in the industry.
----------
---------- ###### AI TRAINING
#### üí°**_[Make Claude an expert at anything with Skills repo](https://app.therundown.ai/guides/make-claude-an-expert-at-anything-with-this-skills-repo)_**
View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/ccb54ec7-9dd7-4b05-9071-fc17535bcdeb/claude_skills_terminal_1456x816.png?t=1769027754) Caption:
**The Rundown:** In this tutorial, you will learn how to supercharge Claude Code for different tasks with a marketplace of ‚Äúskills‚Äù which you can quickly browse and add directly from your CLI.
**Step-by-step:**
1. Open your terminal, type `claude` to start Claude Code, and add the official skills marketplace with `/plugin marketplace add anthropics/skills`
2. Type `/plugins`, go to ‚ÄúBrowse plugins,‚Äù and install skills like **context7**, **frontend-design**, and **document-skills** to expand your agent's capabilities
3. Restart Claude, create a project with context files (like a CSV), then run `claude /init` to generate a **[Claude.md](https://Claude.md)** file that it will update while working
4. Execute tasks by telling Claude to "use the PDF doc tool" to generate a brief on the project, or ask it to use **frontend-design** to "create a simple landing page"
**Pro tip:** You can get more marketing and business tools by installing a community marketplace with `/plugin marketplace add alirezarezvani/claude-skills`.
----------
---------- ###### PRESENTED BY GITLAB
#### ü§ñ** **[_**Agentic AI, real results**_](https://srv.buysellads.com/ads/long/x/T6V2PUDQTTTTTT6CVQPNLTTTTTT5BJPU26TTTTTTVTKHYBVTTTTTTRDYV26H67PUFHFF4L7L232C6RIVC2IFPJLP2RMT)
View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/1b12cb6b-59a7-4a14-89c7-d81a1eabe59b/image2__13_.jpg?t=1769018346) Follow image link: (https://srv.buysellads.com/ads/long/x/T6V2PUDQTTTTTT6CVQPNLTTTTTT5BJPU26TTTTTTVTKHYBVTTTTTTRDYV26H67PUFHFF4L7L232C6RIVC2IFPJLP2RMT) Caption:
**The Rundown:** GitLab Transcend is a virtual event diving into how agentic AI is reshaping software delivery, with live demos, roadmap previews, and conversations with GitLab product leaders.
**Join on Feb. 10 and walk away with:**
* Insights from teams solving real challenges with AI-modernized workflows
* A first look at GitLab's upcoming innovations and investments
* Answers to your questions straight from product leaders
_[Save your spot now](https://srv.buysellads.com/ads/long/x/T6V2PUDQTTTTTT6CVQPNLTTTTTT5BJPU26TTTTTTVTKHYBVTTTTTTRDYV26H67PUFHFF4L7L232C6RIVC2IFPJLP2RMT)_.** **
----------
---------- ###### APPLE
#### üìå [_**Apple eyes AI wearable race with AI pin**_](https://www.theinformation.com/articles/apple-developing-ai-wearable-pin)
View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/199745f0-0c89-455b-bb96-cfc3c462249b/Apple_AI_Pin_Worn_on_Clothing.png?t=1769037746) Caption: Image source: Lovart / The Rundown (Concept Art)
**The Rundown: **Apple is reportedly [working](https://www.theinformation.com/articles/apple-developing-ai-wearable-pin) on a camera-equipped AI-pin wearable roughly the size of an AirTag, according to The Information ‚Äî targeting a 2027 release with up to 20M units at launch.
**The details: **
* The device will include two camera lenses, a trio of mics, and Watch-style magnetic charging into a disc-sized pin worn on clothing or bags.
* Internally, Apple is reportedly pushing for faster timelines than typical to avoid falling further behind OAI, which has its own wearables in the works.
* The category has proven brutal for newcomers, with Humane's hyped pin flopping with under 10K sales before the company sold off assets to HP.
* Bloomberg separately [reported](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2026-01-21/ios-27-apple-to-revamp-siri-as-built-in-iphone-mac-chatbot-to-fend-off-openai) that Apple is building a ChatGPT-style Siri (codenamed "Campos") for iOS 27, replacing the current interface entirely.
**Why it matters: **Apple has moved at a snail‚Äôs pace in AI so far, but between the AI pin, new Siri chatbot, and recent Gemini partnership, the tech giant is finally moving with urgency. If any company can come out with big-time momentum for a consumer AI device, it‚Äôs Apple ‚Äî¬†but after broken promises and delays, skepticism is still warranted.
----------
---------- **QUICK HITS**
----------
---------- ### üõ†Ô∏è _**[Trending AI Tools](https://www.rundown.ai/tools)**_
* üì¶ [Box Extract](https://www.box.com/extract?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=paidinfluencer&utm_theme=icm&utm_campaign=FY26RundownAI_NewTool_Extract)** **- Turn enterprise content into actionable data to securely power faster decisions and automated workflows at scale*
* üé• [Remotion](https://link.therundown.ai/995766) - New agent skill to make videos within Claude Code
* üìö [Gemini](https://www.rundown.ai/tools/google-bard) - New personalized SAT exam prep features
* üß† [Skills](https://www.rundown.ai/tools/skills) - Vercel‚Äôs open ecosystem for agent skills
_*Sponsored Listing_
----------
---------- ### üì∞ **_[Everything else in AI today](https://www.rundown.ai/)_**
**Meta CTO Andrew Bosworth **[said](https://link.therundown.ai/K29dob) the company‚Äôs Superintelligence Labs internally deployed its first models, which are ‚Äòperforming well‚Äô despite being less than a year old.¬†
**OpenAI** [introduced](https://openai.com/index/stargate-community/) Stargate Community, a ‚ÄòGood Neighbor‚Äô plan (like [Microsoft‚Äôs](https://blogs.microsoft.com/on-the-issues/2026/01/13/community-first-ai-infrastructure/)) that commits to fund all energy infra needs so local electricity prices won't rise.
**Google **is [partnering](https://blog.google/products-and-platforms/products/education/practice-sat-gemini/?utm_source=tw&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=og&utm_content=&utm_term=) with The Princeton Review to offer free SAT practice tests inside Gemini with instant feedback and AI-generated study plans.
**YouTube‚Äôs CEO Neal Mohan** [published](https://blog.youtube/inside-youtube/the-future-of-youtube-2026/) 2026 priorities, detailing initiatives including the ability to use AI likenesses in Shorts, combating slop, and expanding AI discovery.
**Anthropic **[released](https://x.com/claudeai/status/2013754136265621952?s=20) new Claude integrations to connect health data to its AI assistant, starting with Apple Health, Health Connect, HealthEx, and Function Health.
----------
---------- **COMMUNITY**
----------
---------- ### ü§ù _**[Community AI workflows](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfH4UPzu72HTpdb08Qlm-0dLwKJIjdcAwCcAvVywcHD6mwKig/viewform)**_
Every newsletter, we showcase how a reader is using AI to work smarter, save time, or make life easier.
Today‚Äôs workflow comes from reader **Joel H.** in Copenhagen, Denmark:
"I used Lovable to build an internal production system for my film projects that replaces spreadsheets, emails, and scattered folders. Each film has its own workspace with crew, cast, tasks, documents, calendars, and funding all in one place. People only see the projects they‚Äôre assigned to, and everything from scripts to budgets is structured and easy to find.
The AI layer is the real time-saver. It scans our project data and funding history, suggests relevant film funds, explains why they‚Äôre a match, and can draft first versions of applications using selected documents. It also summarizes long task threads into clear ‚Äúwhere are we now‚Äù updates."
How do you use AI? Tell us [here](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfH4UPzu72HTpdb08Qlm-0dLwKJIjdcAwCcAvVywcHD6mwKig/viewform).
----------
---------- ### **üéì **_**[Highlights: News, Guides & Events](https://app.therundown.ai/)**_
* Read our last AI newsletter: [AI takes center stage at Davos](https://www.rundown.ai/articles/ai-takes-center-stage-at-davos)

item.title: Exclusive: Anthropic Lowers Profit Margin Projection as Revenue Skyrockets
item.description:
%title%
Exclusive:
"Anthropic Lowers Profit Margin Projection as Revenue Skyrockets" By Sri Muppidi Jan 21, 2026
Anthropic last month projected it would generate a 40% gross profit margin from selling AI to businesses and application developers in 2025, according to two people with knowledge of its financials. That margin was 10 percentage points lower than its earlier optimistic expectations, though it‚Äôs still a big improvement from the year before.
The lower-than-expected gross profit margin resulted from the costs of running Anthropic models for paying customers, in a process known as inference, on servers from Google and Amazon. Those inference costs were 23% higher than the company had anticipated, the projections showed. Anthropic calculates gross margins by subtracting inference costs and other costs of selling its products.
---

item.title: The Briefing: Oracle‚Äôs Dividend Question
item.description:
%title%
The Briefing By Martin Peers Jan 21, 2026
Greetings!Here‚Äôs a question: How much are big tech companies cutting back on sending money to shareholders as they ramp up their AI development spending? It‚Äôs a good time to ask: On Friday, Oracle is due to pay out its latest quarterly dividend of 50 cents a share. That will amount to $1.4 billion going out the door, which Oracle can ill afford. After all, the software and cloud firm burned through $10 billion in cash in the second quarter, thanks to a big increase in capital expenditures related to its AI cloud expansion.And the financial pressure on Oracle is only going to intensify. In the fiscal year that ends in May, analysts estimate it will burn $22.9 billion in cash, according to S&P Global Market Intelligence. That compares with the $900 million cash burn it sustained last fiscal year and is a big switch from the $11.8 billion in free cash flow it produced in fiscal 2024. Analysts are currently projecting Oracle will continue burning cash until fiscal 2029. Cutting the dividend, at least for a few years, would be a smart way to save cash. At the current payout rate, Oracle‚Äôs dividend will cost $5.7 billion this fiscal year, up from $4.7 billion last fiscal year.¬†Oracle in the past couple of years has slashed the money it spends buying back stock, one of the other ways companies return money to shareholders. As recently as 2021, Oracle repurchased $21 billion, an amount that shrank to just $600 million in fiscal 2025. Its dividend, in contrast, has risen 56% in that time period! Because Oracle is borrowing money to cover its cash shortfall, it is effectively borrowing more than it would if it suspended the dividend. Perhaps it will decide to cut off the dividend when it reports earnings in a few weeks, but there‚Äôs a couple of reasons why it likely won‚Äôt.One is that co-founder and executive chair Larry Ellison is the biggest individual recipient of the dividend. He owns about 40.6% of the stock. As a result, he will earn about $2.3 billion of the dividend this year. That money surely comes in handy to support his lifestyle and perhaps to pay the interest on the loans he has taken out against his Oracle stock. Ellison is financially backing his son David‚Äôs $108 billion takeover bid for Warner Bros. Discovery right now: Cutting off the dividend could be problematic for the family. The other argument against a dividend cut is that there are some investment funds that only invest in dividend-paying stocks. Suspending the dividend could prompt those investors to sell Oracle, putting more pressure on its stock price. Still, for Oracle, whether to continue sending billions out the door on the dividend is a question that deserves more scrutiny.Better Late Than NeverApple is finally taking action to compete for AI-interested consumers. The Information today scooped the news that Apple is developing an AI-powered wearable pin the size of an AirTag that will be equipped with a couple of cameras, a speaker and microphones‚Äîallowing it to take pictures, videos and audio from a user‚Äôs surroundings. Apple is moving quickly on the device in hopes of releasing it by 2027‚Äîensuring that it can compete with OpenAI, which hopes to come out with the first of its AI-powered devices before then.Meanwhile, Bloomberg reported Wednesday that Apple plans to revamp Siri by turning it into an AI chatbot, running on an AI model developed by Google. The Siri plans, combined with the AI hardware, should position Apple to compete more effectively as AI becomes more mainstream‚Äîand without spending the hundreds of billions other companies are forking out for AI.Today on The Information‚Äôs TITVCheck out our latest episode of TITV in which we talk about the future of Netflix's ad business In Other News Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang is preparing for a trip to China later this month as the company works to regain its footing in this strategically important market, Bloomberg reported. OpenAI Chief Financial Officer Sarah Friar said the company is ‚Äútaping out‚Äù its custom inference chip‚Äîthe final step before manufacturing‚Äîand touted the progress of its more than $500 billion Stargate infrastructure project in a panel at the World Economic Forum Wednesday. Jeff Bezos‚Äô space company, Blue Origin, is planning to build an ultrafast satellite internet service aimed at large companies, data centers and governments, the company said Wednesday. The service, TeraWave, would put Blue Origin in competition with SpaceX‚Äôs Starlink and Amazon‚Äôs Leo. The Department of Justice on Wednesday named three people to a technical committee that will oversee the implementation of the remedy for Google‚Äôs illegal search monopoly. More here.
Recommendation app Yelp on Wednesday said it had agreed to acquire AI agent startup Hatch for $300 million, or roughly 12 times the startup‚Äôs annual recurring revenue. Recommended NewsletterStart your day with Applied AI, the newsletter from The Information that uncovers how leading businesses are leveraging AI to automate tasks across the board. Subscribe now for free to get it delivered straight to your inbox twice a week.

item.title: OpenAI Names Former TML Staffer Zoph to Oversee Enterprise Push
item.description:
%title%
Exclusive:
"OpenAI Names Former TML Staffer Zoph to Oversee Enterprise Push" By Stephanie Palazzolo and Erin Woo Jan 21, 2026
Barret Zoph, the Thinking Machines Lab cofounder who rejoined OpenAI in a swirl of controversy last week, will lead the company‚Äôs push to sell AI products to businesses, as part of a broader reorganization across the company, OpenAI‚Äôs CEO of Applications Fidji Simo told staff on Wednesday.
Brad Lightcap, OpenAI‚Äôs chief operating officer, will transition out of leading product and engineering for OpenAI‚Äôs business of selling to other enterprises but will continue to run OpenAI‚Äôs commercial functions, according to a copy of the memo seen by The Information.
---

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Entrepreneur Andrew Wilkinson [https://every.to/emails/click/ed86a33a35e615cf1fcbce2979112d7acd5c92bfb325300a311a43694ae80c4a/eyJzdWJqZWN0Ijoi8J-OpyBPcHVzIDQuNSBDaGFuZ2VkIEhvdyBBbmRyZXcgV2lsa2luc29uIFdvcmtzIGFuZCBMaXZlcyIsInBvc3RfaWQiOjM5MDYsInBvc3RfdHlwZSI6InBvc3QiLCJ1cmwiOiJodHRwczovL3guY29tL2F3aWxraW5zb24iLCJwb3NpdGlvbiI6MTZ9] used to sleep nine hours a night. Now he wakes up at 4 a.m. and goes straight to work‚Äîbecause he can‚Äôt wait to keep building with Anthropic‚Äôs latest model, Opus 4.5 [https://every.to/emails/click/ed86a33a35e615cf1fcbce2979112d7acd5c92bfb325300a311a43694ae80c4a/eyJzdWJqZWN0Ijoi8J-OpyBPcHVzIDQuNSBDaGFuZ2VkIEhvdyBBbmRyZXcgV2lsa2luc29uIFdvcmtzIGFuZCBMaXZlcyIsInBvc3RfaWQiOjM5MDYsInBvc3RfdHlwZSI6InBvc3QiLCJ1cmwiOiJodHRwczovL2V2ZXJ5LnRvL3ZpYmUtY2hlY2svdmliZS1jaGVjay1vcHVzLTQtNS1pcy10aGUtY29kaW5nLW1vZGVsLXdlLXZlLWJlZW4td2FpdGluZy1mb3IiLCJwb3NpdGlvbiI6MTd9].
Two years ago, Wilkinson was obsessed with vibe coding on AI software development platform Replit [https://every.to/emails/click/ed86a33a35e615cf1fcbce2979112d7acd5c92bfb325300a311a43694ae80c4a/eyJzdWJqZWN0Ijoi8J-OpyBPcHVzIDQuNSBDaGFuZ2VkIEhvdyBBbmRyZXcgV2lsa2luc29uIFdvcmtzIGFuZCBMaXZlcyIsInBvc3RfaWQiOjM5MDYsInBvc3RfdHlwZSI6InBvc3QiLCJ1cmwiOiJodHRwczovL2V2ZXJ5LnRvL2NoYWluLW9mLXRob3VnaHQvYWktYW5kLXRoZS1mdXR1cmUtb2YtcHJvZ3JhbW1pbmciLCJwb3NpdGlvbiI6MTh9]. It was thrilling to describe something in plain English and watch an app appear, less thrilling when the apps were always broken in some way, often full of maddening bugs. So he set his app creation ambitions aside until technology caught up with them.
Then, a few weeks ago, he started playing with Claude Code [https://every.to/emails/click/ed86a33a35e615cf1fcbce2979112d7acd5c92bfb325300a311a43694ae80c4a/eyJzdWJqZWN0Ijoi8J-OpyBPcHVzIDQuNSBDaGFuZ2VkIEhvdyBBbmRyZXcgV2lsa2luc29uIFdvcmtzIGFuZCBMaXZlcyIsInBvc3RfaWQiOjM5MDYsInBvc3RfdHlwZSI6InBvc3QiLCJ1cmwiOiJodHRwczovL2V2ZXJ5LnRvL3NvdXJjZS1jb2RlL2hvdy1pLXVzZS1jbGF1ZGUtY29kZS10by1zaGlwLWxpa2UtYS10ZWFtLW9mLWZpdmUiLCJwb3NpdGlvbiI6MTl9] and Opus 4.5. It felt, he says, like having a ‚Äú$100,000-a-month payroll of engineers‚Äù working for him around the clock.
Wilkinson is the cofounder of Tiny [https://every.to/emails/click/ed86a33a35e615cf1fcbce2979112d7acd5c92bfb325300a311a43694ae80c4a/eyJzdWJqZWN0Ijoi8J-OpyBPcHVzIDQuNSBDaGFuZ2VkIEhvdyBBbmRyZXcgV2lsa2luc29uIFdvcmtzIGFuZCBMaXZlcyIsInBvc3RfaWQiOjM5MDYsInBvc3RfdHlwZSI6InBvc3QiLCJ1cmwiOiJodHRwczovL3RpbnkuY29tLyIsInBvc2l0aW9uIjoyMH0=], a company that buys profitable businesses and holds them for the long term. The Tiny portfolio includes the AeroPress [https://every.to/emails/click/ed86a33a35e615cf1fcbce2979112d7acd5c92bfb325300a311a43694ae80c4a/eyJzdWJqZWN0Ijoi8J-OpyBPcHVzIDQuNSBDaGFuZ2VkIEhvdyBBbmRyZXcgV2lsa2luc29uIFdvcmtzIGFuZCBMaXZlcyIsInBvc3RfaWQiOjM5MDYsInBvc3RfdHlwZSI6InBvc3QiLCJ1cmwiOiJodHRwczovL2Flcm9wcmVzcy5jb20vIiwicG9zaXRpb24iOjIxfQ==] coffee maker and Dribbble [https://every.to/emails/click/ed86a33a35e615cf1fcbce2979112d7acd5c92bfb325300a311a43694ae80c4a/eyJzdWJqZWN0Ijoi8J-OpyBPcHVzIDQuNSBDaGFuZ2VkIEhvdyBBbmRyZXcgV2lsa2luc29uIFdvcmtzIGFuZCBMaXZlcyIsInBvc3RfaWQiOjM5MDYsInBvc3RfdHlwZSI6InBvc3QiLCJ1cmwiOiJodHRwczovL2RyaWJiYmxlLmNvbS8iLCJwb3NpdGlvbiI6MjJ9], a platform where designers can share their work and find jobs. Dan Shipper [https://every.to/emails/click/ed86a33a35e615cf1fcbce2979112d7acd5c92bfb325300a311a43694ae80c4a/eyJzdWJqZWN0Ijoi8J-OpyBPcHVzIDQuNSBDaGFuZ2VkIEhvdyBBbmRyZXcgV2lsa2luc29uIFdvcmtzIGFuZCBMaXZlcyIsInBvc3RfaWQiOjM5MDYsInBvc3RfdHlwZSI6InBvc3QiLCJ1cmwiOiJodHRwczovL2V2ZXJ5LnRvL0BkYW5zaGlwcGVyIiwicG9zaXRpb24iOjIzfQ==] had him on AI & I [https://every.to/emails/click/ed86a33a35e615cf1fcbce2979112d7acd5c92bfb325300a311a43694ae80c4a/eyJzdWJqZWN0Ijoi8J-OpyBPcHVzIDQuNSBDaGFuZ2VkIEhvdyBBbmRyZXcgV2lsa2luc29uIFdvcmtzIGFuZCBMaXZlcyIsInBvc3RfaWQiOjM5MDYsInBvc3RfdHlwZSI6InBvc3QiLCJ1cmwiOiJodHRwczovL2V2ZXJ5LnRvL3BvZGNhc3QiLCJwb3NpdGlvbiI6MjR9] to talk about the automations Wilkinson has built for his work and personal life, including an AI relationship counselor, a custom email client, and a system that texts him outfit recommendations each morning. Wilkinson revealed how all of this individual exploration has changed the way he thinks about buying software companies at Tiny.
