item.title: Thinking Machines implosion ü§ñ, Gemini Chrome Skills ‚ö°, Humans& $480M seed üí∞
item.description:
Google DeepMind's CEO, Demis Hassabis, says that Chinese AI companies remain around six months behind the frontier AI of the leading Western labs¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†
Sign Up [1] |Advertise [2]|View Online [3]
TLDR
TOGETHER WITH [AWS] [4]
TLDR AI 2026-01-21
AGENTIC AI ON THE RISE: KEYS TO UNLOCKING VALUE (SPONSOR) [4]
When it comes to your business, don't overlook AI agents and the broad set of tasks they can help with.¬† The latest tools can help drive innovation and we found a helpful eBook [4] that explores how it's being done in the real world.¬†
Are you curious about AI agents that can reason, plan, and act to accomplish goals, with limited human involvement?
Agentic AI on the rise [4]: Keys to unlocking value from AWS provides answers. Whether just getting started or ready to launch an AI agent today, you'll find guidance to simplify your AI agent journey.¬† [4]
üöÄ
HEADLINES & LAUNCHES
DEEPMIND CEO SAYS CHINESE AI FIRMS ARE 6 MONTHS BEHIND THE WEST (3 MINUTE READ) [5]
Google DeepMind's CEO, Demis Hassabis, says that Chinese AI companies remain around six months behind the frontier AI of the leading Western labs. He says the response to DeepSeek's R1 model last year was a massive overreaction and that while Chinese firms are very good at catching up to the frontier, they have yet to show they can innovate beyond that. Some of the barriers to Chinese AI development are set to come down as the Trump administration is easing a ban on advanced AI chip exports to China. Sales of the most advanced AI processors will remain blocked on national security grounds.
GEMINI IN CHROME IS GETTING ‚ÄúSKILLS‚Äù AS IT MOVES TOWARD BECOMING A FULL AI AGENT (2 MINUTE READ) [6]
Gemini in Chrome is being upgraded into a proactive agent capable of performing complex tasks on users' behalf. A hidden internal page for 'skills' has been spotted in testing. The page features a dedicated interface where users can define specific capabilities for the AI. Skills will effectively allow users to 'teach' Gemini how to handle specific or repetitive workflows within the browser.
THE MESSY HUMAN DRAMA THAT DEALT A BLOW TO ONE OF AI'S HOTTEST STARTUPS (5 MINUTE READ) [7]
Mira Murati says that Barret Zoph was fired from Thinking Machines Lab after repeated concerns about his conduct and lack of productivity. Zoph claims he was fired for expressing an intent to take a job elsewhere. Within hours of Zoph's firing, Zoph, another co-founder, and a third employee had signed offers to rejoin OpenAI. The departures are a sign of how the AI race is as much a battle for talent as technology.
AI STARTUP HUMANS& RAISES $480 MILLION AT $4.5 BILLION VALUATION IN SEED ROUND (2 MINUTE READ) [8]
AI startup Humans& has secured $480 million in seed funding, reaching a $4.5 billion valuation. Key participants included Nvidia, Jeff Bezos, and GV. The company aims to develop human-centric AI for improved communication and collaboration. A product launch is expected early this year. The founding team consists of experts from OpenAI, Google DeepMind, and Meta.
üß†
DEEP DIVES & ANALYSIS
WITHOUT BENCHMARKING LLMS, YOU'RE LIKELY OVERPAYING 5-10X (10 MINUTE READ) [9]
Those paying for LLM APIs and have never tested alternatives are likely overpaying. There are almost always cheaper options with comparable quality for every workflow. Benchmarking and finding an optimal model is a complex process, but it can result in significant savings. This post discusses how one team navigated the process to save thousands of dollars.
THE TRAGEDY OF THE AGENTIC COMMONS (14 MINUTE READ) [10]
AI agents can improve matching markets, like dating or job searches, by using LLMs to convert unstructured preferences into actionable data, outperforming standard questionnaires. However, in markets where everyone uses AI agents, congestion increases significantly, reducing efficiency without a pricing mechanism. Introducing prices and institutional design can alleviate congestion, streamline coordination, and enhance market efficiency.
MY AGENTS ARE WORKING. ARE YOURS? (14 MINUTE READ) [11]
AI agents are significantly increasing productivity by automating the analysis of thousands of research papers. A new anti-AI tool, Poison Fountain, corrupts AI training data to combat the perceived threat of machine intelligence.
üßë‚Äçüíª
ENGINEERING & RESEARCH
INWORLD RELEASES NEW TTS MODEL DESIGNED FOR THE NEXT WAVE OF CONSUMER AI APPLICATIONS (SPONSOR) [12]
Inworld released TTS-1.5, building on their #1-ranked position on the Artificial Analysis leaderboard. The new model achieves sub-250ms P90 latency, enabling natural conversation at thousands of queries per second. With 30% greater expressiveness, 40% lower word error rates, and 25x lower cost than alternatives, TTS-1.5 is designed for developers building high-demand, realtime applications at consumer scale.
Try TTS-1.5 [12] Learn More [13]
INTRODUCING FASTMCP 3.0 üöÄ (11 MINUTE READ) [14]
FastMCP 3.0 was built to be as durable as it is future-proof. It moves beyond simple tool servers and enters the era of Context Applications: rich, adaptive systems that manage the information flow to agents. FastMCP 3.0 can source components from anywhere, compose and transform them freely, personalize what each user sees, track state across sessions, and more. The first beta is available now.
REPO: CONTENT-AWARE ATTENTION REORDERING (18 MINUTE READ) [15]
RePo is a module that repositions tokens based on contextual relevance rather than fixed order, improving long-range attention and robustness to noisy or structured inputs. The method draws on Cognitive Load Theory to justify reorganizing input structure for more efficient model processing.
DIFFERENTIAL TRANSFORMER V2 (12 MINUTE READ) [16]
DIFF V2 features key upgrades over DIFF V1: faster inference via compatibility with FlashAttention, better training stability by removing per-head RMSNorm, and a simplified Œª parameterization that eliminates complex initialization schemes.
WAYPOINT-1: REAL-TIME INTERACTIVE VIDEO DIFFUSION FROM OVERWORLD (5 MINUTE READ) [17]
Waypoint-1 is a real-time-interactive video diffusion model. It can be controlled and prompted via text, mouse, and keyboard. Users can give the model some frames, run it, then have it create a world that they can interact with. They can move the camera freely with the mouse and input any key on the keyboard, all with zero latency. Each frame is generated with the controls as context. The model runs fast enough to provide a seamless experience, even on consumer hardware.
üéÅ
MISCELLANEOUS
AI GAINS STARTING TO SHOW IN THE REAL ECONOMY (6 MINUTE READ) [18]
The introduction of AI tools like Claude Cowork and Alibaba's Qwen Assistant marks a shift towards AI's real-world applications, similar to ChatGPT's accessibility impact. Recent data from Q3 2025 shows a 4.9% productivity jump, with minimal change in hours worked, indicating potential initial AI-driven efficiency gains. Despite early-stage adoption, these developments could significantly boost economic productivity and eventually increase living standards.
ANTHROPIC CEO: SELLING H200S TO CHINA IS LIKE GIVING NUKES TO NORTH KOREA (4 MINUTE READ) [19]
Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei has likened the decision to allow Nvidia to sell GPUs to Chinese companies to giving nuclear weapons to an adversary. The Trump administration announced just over a month ago that it would allow shipments of Nvidia H200 accelerators to Chinese customers as long as the US received 25% of the revenues. Chinese authorities have yet to allow local buyers to acquire the GPUs. Anthropic wants stricter controls on AI exports, saying access to the chips would put Chinese model developers in a better position to compete with the West.
‚ö°
QUICK LINKS
TLDR IS HIRING A SENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER, APPLIED AI ($200K-$300K, FULLY REMOTE) [20]
As the first engineer on TLDR's new Applied AI team, you'll build AI agents and composable Claude Skills to let non-technical teammates create their own AI workflows.¬†Learn more [21].
GOOGLE SAYS GEMINI WON'T HAVE ADS, AS CHATGPT PREPARES TO ADD THEM (1 MINUTE READ) [22]
While Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis has confirmed that Gemini won't get ads for now, Google has not confirmed that it will never add ads to Gemini.
ELON MUSK SAYS TESLA'S RESTARTED DOJO3 WILL BE FOR ‚ÄòSPACE-BASED AI COMPUTE' (3 MINUTE READ) [23]
Tesla plans to restart its Dojo3 AI chip project focused on space-based AI compute.
CHATGPT SELF PORTRAIT (3 MINUTE READ) [24]
ChatGPT's response to a prompt about user treatment often reflects the user's behavior and framing.
GLM-4.7-FLASH (2 MINUTE READ) [25]
GLM-4.7-Flash is a 30B-class MoE model designed for local deployment in coding, agent tasks, translation, and creative writing.
OPENAI ROLLS OUT AGE PREDICTION IN CHATGPT (3 MINUTE READ) [26]
OpenAI introduced an age prediction model for ChatGPT consumer accounts to help apply teen-specific safety protections.

Exclusive:
"TikTok Plans Big Shopping Push" By Jing Yang and Juro Osawa Jan 21, 2026
TikTok‚Äôs U.S. business may be about to take off.
The scheduled completion this week of TikTok‚Äôs sale of its U.S. data security arm to a joint venture ends years of uncertainty about its future in the U.S. And the video app maker is now redoubling its efforts to build a much bigger e-commerce business in the U.S., in a new challenge to Amazon.
---

item.title: Rise of solo founders üßë‚ÄçüöÄ, exec vibe coding üë®‚Äçüíª, model market fit ü§ñ
item.description:
Solo founders now launch 36% of new startups. AI tools let one person handle coding, design, marketing, analytics, and support¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†
Sign Up [1] |Advertise [2]|View Online [3]
TLDR
¬†TLDR FOUNDERS 2026-01-21
üìà
HEADLINES & TRENDS
WHY ONE THIRD OF ALL STARTUPS ARE SOLO FOUNDED (5 MINUTE READ) [4]
Solo founders now launch 36% of new startups, up from under 25% in 2019, marking the first time in over 50 years that a single founder builds more than a third of new companies. AI tools let one person handle coding, design, marketing, analytics, and support, enabling solo founders to compete with multi-person teams. Investors are increasingly backing solo founders because singular decision-making preserves ‚Äúauthorship,‚Äù creating coherent products and faster execution while avoiding co-founder conflicts.
MODEL-MARKET FIT (8 MINUTE READ) [5]
Product-market fit has a prerequisite most AI founders ignore. Before the market can pull your product, the model has to actually be capable of doing the job. Legal AI was stuck for years until GPT-4 crossed the threshold, then minted more unicorns in 18 months than the previous decade. You can tell when MMF is missing by how human-in-the-loop gets positioned. When it exists, human oversight is a feature. When it doesn't, it's a crutch. The dangerous zone is betting on capability that's 24-36 months away.
üß†
STRATEGIES & TACTICS
MASTERING COLD EMAIL (10 MINUTE READ) [6]
Cold email still works, otherwise nobody would be doing it. The problem is that most people only understand adding volume when they should focus on messaging potency. For less than $1,000, you can personalize emails to 10,000 people in a day. The key insight is rethinking your offer because demos are dead. Nobody has time for them anymore. The best offers are valuable to the user, aligned with what you actually sell, and filter for good-fit customers.
PERSONAL LAND-MINES DETERMINE STARTUP FAILURE (3 MINUTE READ) [7]
The biggest reason startups fail isn't market timing, competition, or tech risk, it's the founder's personal life. Divorce, co-founder breakups, substance issues, or shifting priorities are consistent ‚Äúland-mines‚Äù that end companies. Early-stage investing isn't just underwriting an idea. It's underwriting a human over a long, unpredictable journey. Founder durability and momentum through life's pressures may matter more than almost any other factor in startup success.
‚öíÔ∏è
TOOLS & RESOURCES
82% OF RANSOMWARE ATTACKS TARGET SMBS - HERE'S HOW TO BUILD YOUR READINESS ROADMAP (SPONSOR) [8]
Think you can fly under the radar? The vast majority of ransomware attacks target organizations with <1,000 employees... and many clients now demand enterprise-grade compliance to do business. Need to get up to speed? Download Kobalt's 2026 Cybersecurity Readiness Roadmap [8] and get a versatile blueprint tailored specifically for SMBs Get your copy [8]
NOODLE SEED (TOOL) [9]
Noodle Seed is a No-code platform for creating branded AI apps that surface businesses in AI chat interfaces.
OS NINJA (TOOL) [10]
OS Ninja is an AI-guided learning platform that turns open source repositories into interactive code exploration experiences.
FLOWGENIE (TOOL) [11]
FlowGenie is a no-code platform for building forms and automations with a visual, node-based workflow editor.
üéÅ
MISCELLANEOUS
WHY EVERY EXEC SHOULD BE VIBECODING (14 MINUTE READ) [12]
The role of leadership is changing. Pure leadership and management are no longer a full-time job. The future will see more seniors and executives working as part-time individual contributors. Vibecoding is a great way to experience the balance. Company leaders can't afford to miss out on this skillset.
THE COMMODITIZATION OF SERVICES (5 MINUTE READ) [13]
Before electrification, light was scarce and expensive. When it became cheap, people stopped thinking about the cost of turning on a switch. We're at the same moment with AI agents. Services that cost hundreds of thousands will cost tens to hundreds. The current agency model and vertical SaaS both rely on friction that's disappearing. If the cost of production drops to near zero, price must follow.
‚ö°
QUICK LINKS
THE MILLION DOLLAR SLOP FIGHT (7 MINUTE READ) [14]
X is offering $1M for the top article posted in the next two weeks.
10 TACTICS BEEHIIV USED TO HIT $2M MRR (2 MINUTE READ) [15]
Tactical thread on doing things that don't scale and why monthly investor updates are the highest leverage thing he does.
SCALING TEAMS: PEOPLE, PROJECTS, AND PROCESS (6 MINUTE READ) [16]
Good scaling requires thoughtfully addressing the specific constraints a team is facing, evolving approaches as the team and organization change, and always keeping the focus on people and delivering value effectively.
THE POSTMODERN DATA STACK IS AI (2 MINUTE READ) [17]
The modern data stack works brilliantly for structured data, but businesses thrive on unstructured data, something AI excels in.

item.title: 2026 Platform Engineering ‚åõ, PostgreSQL Optimizations üèÉ, Human Native Joins Cloudflare ‚òÅÔ∏è
item.description:
Platform engineering transitioned into an industrial standard by 2025, enabling mature organizations to halve time-to-market¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†
Sign Up [1] |Advertise [2]|View Online [3]
TLDR
TOGETHER WITH [Granola] [4]
TLDR DEVOPS 2026-01-21
GRANOLA: TURN YOUR RAW MEETINGS NOTES INTO SOMETHING AWESOME (SPONSOR) [4]
_Get __one month free_ [4]_ with code TLDR1MO_
What if you could be fully present at a meeting, but still have super-detailed notes focused on what matters to you?
Granola [4] takes your raw meeting notes and makes them awesome. It adds the full context from your conversations, so your "Q4 priorities?" notes becomes a full list.¬†
It's like Apple Notes, except you have full transcription, searchable context, and one click to share. And it all happens on your Mac or your iPhone with NO MEETING BOTS.
Try it once, and you'll be hooked. Use code TLDR1MO to claim your free month [4], including unlimited meetings notes + history.
üì±
NEWS & TRENDS
GITLAB ANNOUNCES GENERAL AVAILABILITY OF GITLAB DUO AGENT PLATFORM (4 MINUTE READ) [5]
GitLab Duo Agent Platform is now in general availability. The platform enables orchestrated AI agents across the full software lifecycle to address delivery bottlenecks beyond coding. It offers agentic chat, prebuilt and custom agents, governance controls, and usage-based pricing via GitLab Credits.
BEING A PLATFORM ENGINEER IN 2026: CAREER REALITY CHECK (5 MINUTE READ) [6]
Platform engineering transitioned into an industrial standard by 2025, enabling mature organizations to achieve 20:1 developer-to-platform-engineer ratios and halve time-to-market. Average salaries, now at $160,000 in North America and $104,000 in Europe, reflect the role's democratization rather than devaluation. AI literacy has become a survival-level competency for practitioners.
üöÄ
OPINIONS & TUTORIALS
WHAT AI IS ACTUALLY GOOD FOR, ACCORDING TO DEVELOPERS (5 MINUTE READ) [7]
This post discusses AI coding tools designed to protect developer flow with contextual, customizable help rather than chat-centered automation, prioritizing human judgment, learning, minimal interruptions, and refinement driven by feedback that removes tedium without disrupting creativity.
UNCONVENTIONAL POSTGRESQL OPTIMIZATIONS (13 MINUTE READ) [8]
Unconventional PostgreSQL techniques such as constraint_exclusion, function-based indexes on lower-cardinality expressions, virtual generated columns, and hash-backed exclusion constraints can significantly reduce query execution time, index size, and unnecessary full-table scans. These approaches outperform standard full-table scans and B-tree indexing in analytics-heavy and ad-hoc query workloads by better aligning indexes and constraints with actual query needs.
üßë‚Äçüíª
RESOURCES & TOOLS
PLATFORM ENGINEERING ON KUBERNETES: AN OPEN SOURCE-FIRST APPROACH (SPONSOR) [9]
The Manning book¬†_Platform Engineering on Kubernetes_ [9]¬†takes an in-depth look at the latest best practices and open source tools from the Kubernetes community, including:
* Multi-cloud infrastructure management with Crossplane * Using Dapr for standard API distribution * Implementing feature flags with OpenFeature
Grab a free copy of the ebook from Chronosphere [9]
TERRAFORM SKILL (GITHUB REPO) [10]
A new Claude Agent Skill for Terraform and OpenTofu has been introduced, offering comprehensive guidance on testing strategies, module patterns, CI/CD workflows, and production-ready infrastructure code for Claude Code users.
AGENT-LIGHTNING (GITHUB REPO) [11]
agent-lightning is an open-source framework for training and optimizing AI agents‚Äîenabling reinforcement learning (RL), automatic prompt optimization, supervised fine-tuning, and more‚Äîwithout requiring substantial changes to existing agent code. It works with virtually any agent framework (e.g., LangChain, OpenAI Agents SDK, and AutoGen) and provides modular components to collect agent execution data and iteratively improve agent performance via a decoupled RL training loop.
üéÅ
MISCELLANEOUS
SELF-DRIVING DEVOPS? HOW STAKPAK TACKLES INFRASTRUCTURE COMPLEXITY (5 MINUTE READ) [12]
Stakpak introduced an open-source DevOps agent aimed at making infrastructure more autonomous by securing secrets, preventing destructive actions with guardrails, and centralizing shared operational knowledge so AI can handle complex, non-coding DevOps tasks reliably.
MAKING VERY SMALL LLMS SMARTER WITH RAG (7 MINUTE READ) [13]
Small, local LLMs can be effectively leveraged for niche development tasks by implementing Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG). This approach allows LLMs to generate accurate code snippets for the custom Nova Golang library, addressing limitations faced by larger commercial models unaware of such specialized projects.
IP ADDRESSES THROUGH 2025 (45 MINUTE READ) [14]
IPv4 is effectively ‚Äúpost-exhaustion‚Äù by 2025: the globally allocated public pool is flat to slightly shrinking (~3.687B allocated at end-2025, down ~237k on the year), remaining free space sits mostly in APNIC/AFRINIC, and scarcity is managed via NAT/CGNAT plus an active‚Äîbut cooling‚Äîtransfer market whose prices fell sharply through 2025. IPv6 keeps growing in deployment, but 2025 saw fewer and much smaller allocations (big drop in total /32s allocated), and the Internet's trajectory is still shaped by the client/server + NAT model rather than a return to universal, publicly reachable end hosts.
‚ö°
QUICK LINKS
RUN TESTS IN CI AGAINST A REAL ENVIRONMENT (SPONSOR) [15]
mirrord for CI lets you run tests against your staging or pre-prod Kubernetes environment without deploying code or spinning up test environments. Get faster, more reliable CI feedback at a lower cost. Learn more [15]
HUMAN NATIVE IS JOINING CLOUDFLARE (3 MINUTE READ) [16]
Cloudflare has acquired UK-based Human Native to expand licensed, high-quality AI data access and give content owners control over AI usage.
TOP 28 KUBERNETES RESOURCES FOR 2026: LEARN AND STAY UP-TO-DATE (2 MINUTE READ) [17]
This comprehensive guide for engineers on the Kubernetes and cloud-native ecosystem curates high-signal resources from fundamentals to advanced operations for building Internal Developer Platforms and running AI/ML workloads.
10 OBSERVABILITY TOOLS PLATFORM ENGINEERS SHOULD EVALUATE IN 2026 (5 MINUTE READ) [18]
32.8% of practitioners identify observability as a main focus.

item.title: Mastra 1.0 üöÄ, stop overpaying for LLMs üí∞, AI‚Äôs missing ingredient üç≥
item.description:
Mastra, an AI agent framework for TypeScript, has officially announced the stable release of version 1.0, with Server Adapters for easier deployment¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†
Sign Up [1] |Advertise [2]|View Online [3]
TLDR
TOGETHER WITH [QA Wolf] [4]
¬†TLDR DEV 2026-01-21
üëã GOODBYE LOW TEST COVERAGE AND SLOW QA CYCLES (SPONSOR) [4]
Bugs sneak out when less than 80% of user flows are tested before shipping. However, getting that kind of coverage (and staying there) is hard and pricey for any team.
QA Wolf's [5] AI-native solution provides high-volume, high-speed test coverage for web and mobile apps, reducing your organization's QA cycle to minutes.¬†
They can get you:
* 80% automated E2E test coverage in weeks [6]‚Äînot years * Unlimited parallel test runs [7] * 24-hour maintenance and on-demand test creation * Zero flakes, guaranteed
The benefit? No more manual E2E testing. No more slow QA cycles. No more bugs reaching production.
With QA Wolf, Drata's team of engineers [8] achieved 4x more test cases and 86% FASTER QA CYCLES.
GET STARTED FOR FREE [4]
üßë‚Äçüíª
ARTICLES & TUTORIALS
HOW HIGHTOUCH BUILT THEIR LONG-RUNNING AGENT HARNESS (15 MINUTE READ) [9]
Hightouch developed an AI marketing agent capable of complex, multi-step tasks. Its team explicitly separated the model's planning from its execution, allowing for dynamic plan updates as the agent learns from data. To manage context, they used "agentic delegation" through techniques like buffering large data to a temporary filesystem and spawning dynamic subagents for isolated, complex sub-tasks.
UNCONVENTIONAL POSTGRESQL OPTIMIZATIONS (20 MINUTE READ) [10]
This article goes over some unconventional PostgreSQL optimization techniques that go beyond standard practices like simple indexing. One method involves enabling `constraint_exclusion` to remove unnecessary full table scans when queries contradict existing check constraints. Another technique optimizes for lower cardinality by creating function-based indexes (e.g., on just the date part of a timestamp), which are made consistently usable and efficient with virtual generated columns.
üß†
OPINIONS & ADVICE
I'M ADDICTED TO BEING USEFUL (5 MINUTE READ) [11]
A staff software engineer deeply loves his job despite current industry stresses because of his addiction to being useful. He gets satisfaction in work that aligns with his compulsion to solve problems. His role is perfectly tailored to this, as he feels an almost physical discomfort until he resolves a technical challenge.
AI'S MISSING INGREDIENT (6 MINUTE READ) [12]
The current reliance on basic chatbot interfaces underutilizes AI's potential. This failure of imagination comes from the absence of design. AI needs more design expertise to create better products.
üöÄ
LAUNCHES & TOOLS
ANNOUNCING MASTRA 1.0! (7 MINUTE READ) [13]
Mastra, an AI agent framework for TypeScript, has officially announced the stable release of version 1.0. This version includes Server Adapters for easier deployment, Composite Storage for flexible backend configurations, and full support for Vercel's AI SDK v6.
PIPENET (WEBSITE) [14]
Pipenet is a modern, open-source alternative to localtunnel that provides a bundled client and server to host your own secure tunnel infrastructure. It allows users to expose local services to the internet, share local development servers, test webhooks, or embed tunneling capabilities directly into their own applications.
WXPATH (GITHUB REPO) [15]
wxpath is a Python library for declarative web crawling and data extraction, where traversal and extraction logic are expressed directly using XPath. It introduces custom XPath operators like `url(...)` and `///url(...)` to enable deep, breadth-first web graph exploration within a single expression.
üéÅ
MISCELLANEOUS
WITHOUT BENCHMARKING LLMS, YOU'RE LIKELY OVERPAYING 5-10X (9 MINUTE READ) [16]
Many users overpay for LLM API calls because common benchmarks don't accurately predict performance or cost-effectiveness for their specific tasks, leading them to default to popular but expensive models. This article goes over a benchmarking methodology that involves collecting real prompts, defining expected outputs, running numerous LLMs via a unified API, and using an LLM-as-judge to score responses based on quality, cost, and latency. This process consistently revealed that many users can achieve comparable quality at much lower costs, often cutting bills by 80% or more.
AI AGENTS AT WORK: REAL-TIME PLATFORM INSIGHTS IN SLACK (8 MINUTE READ) [17]
Monday.com developed an AI Slack bot to help devs quickly access real-time platform insights without having to manually check internal tools or dig through notifications. The bot uses LLM agents connected to their microservices data through an MCP. To prevent the AI from hallucinating data, they pre-computed statistics rather than letting the model calculate them.
RUNNING CLAUDE CODE DANGEROUSLY (SAFELY) (6 MINUTE READ) [18]
The author wanted to use Claude Code with the `--dangerously-skip-permissions` flag for an improved workflow, but needed a safe, isolated environment to prevent accidental damage to their host system. They initially considered Docker, but issues like Docker-in-Docker requiring privileged mode made it unsuitable for true sandboxing. They chose Vagrant to create a disposable virtual machine, which offers full isolation and a reproducible configuration.
‚ö°
QUICK LINKS
CLAUDE CHILL (GITHUB REPO) [19]
Claude Chill is a PTY proxy that tames Claude Code's massive terminal updates by rendering only screen differences, preserving history, and enabling lookback to prevent lag, flicker, and broken scrollback.
WHY AI CODING TOOLS SHIFT THE REAL BOTTLENECK TO REVIEW (8 MINUTE READ) [20]
Through testing identical features built manually versus with AI, this developer found that AI generates 2-6√ó more code with extensive defensive patterns and edge-case handling, changing review questions from "what's missing?" to "is all this complexity necessary?"
THE CHALLENGES OF SOFT DELETE (10 MINUTE READ) [21]
The common `archived_at` column for soft delete has too many complexities, and instead, alternatives like database triggers should be considered.
THE AGENT SKILLS DIRECTORY (WEBSITE) [22]
Skills are reusable, plugin-like capabilities that provide procedural knowledge to help AI agents more effectively accomplish specific tasks, and this website is a directory of the most useful skills.

item.title: ChatGPT uses Google Shopping üõçÔ∏è, smarter 404 pages ‚ö†Ô∏è, AI Overview UX fail üò°
item.description:
ChatGPT‚Äôs product carousels are largely shaped by Google Shopping results. The top recommended items frequently match Google Shopping listings¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†
Sign Up [1] |Advertise [2]|View Online [3]
TLDR
TOGETHER WITH [Asana] [4]
TLDR MARKETING 2026-01-21
ENGAGEMENT DOESN'T PAY THE BILLS. MAKE YOUR MARKETING COUNT WITH ASANA. (SPONSOR) [4]
Marketers everywhere are feeling the pressure: launch more campaigns, ship them faster, do it all with fewer resources‚Äîand prove that you're actually moving the needle on revenue.
But don't despair, dear marketer. There is a way to do more with less, and it's Asana [4].¬†
Asana is the work platform where human + AI collaboration comes together [4], helping marketing teams to mobilize around clear goals, drive impact, and scale campaign workflows.
TRY ASANA FOR FREE‚Üí [4]
üì±
NEWS & TRENDS
CHATGPT SEARCHES GOOGLE SHOPPING TO CREATE ITS RECOMMENDATIONS (4 MINUTE READ) [5]
ChatGPT's product carousels are largely shaped by Google Shopping results. Experiments show that the top recommended items frequently match high-ranking Google Shopping listings. This means ecommerce brands that want visibility inside ChatGPT need to prioritize clean and accurate Google Shopping feeds with up-to-date pricing, titles, images, and availability rather than focusing only on conversational SEO.
THE 8 MOST INFLUENTIAL CONTENT MARKETING TRENDS FOR 2026 (13 MINUTE READ) [6]
The dominant content trend for 2026 is the decline of search clicks as AI-generated answers replace traditional browsing behavior. To stay visible, brands are restructuring articles with direct answers and long question-based subheads so AI systems can extract and cite them. Multimedia content is gaining leverage because YouTube videos and interactive formats appear directly in AI summaries and closed platforms. At the same time, email lists and social audiences are becoming more valuable as owned distribution channels as search traffic becomes more unpredictable.
üöÄ
STRATEGIES & TACTICS
FROM DEAD-END TO DISCOVERY: TURNING YOUR WORDPRESS 404 PAGE INTO A SMART PAGE (3 MINUTE READ) [7]
A smarter WordPress 404 page can recover lost traffic by parsing the failed URL and extracting meaningful keywords to automatically surface relevant posts instead of forcing users to search again. The approach replaces a dead-end error with contextual content discovery, using internal search logic and sensible fallbacks to reduce bounce rates while preserving SEO value.
SEO TIP: SEE HOW GOOGLE IS INDEXING YOUR SITE AT SCALE (1 MINUTE READ) [8]
Screaming Frog's Google Search Console integration can audit indexation at scale through the URL Inspection API. Connect the Google account linked to GSC, select the property, enable URL Inspection, and run a crawl in Spider mode to pull Coverage, Indexability, and last crawl data directly into the report. It allows review of up to 2K URLs per day and is faster than checking pages one by one in GSC.
POM WONDERFUL MARKETING STRATEGY AND CAMPAIGNS (3 MINUTE READ) [9]
POM Wonderful turned a hard-to-use fruit into a premium functional beverage by creating the pomegranate juice category and owning the supply chain. Only 12% of Americans knew about pomegranates early on, so it focused on education through its website, design, and self-funded science while positioning the product as a luxury health drink. It invested over $25 million in research and used provocative campaigns like Cheat Death and fantasy-driven ads to make abstract health claims memorable. Distinctive bottle design, vertical integration in California farming, and broad distribution helped it scale into a billion-dollar brand. The category is now crowded, and its challenge is to reclaim leadership rather than blend in.
üßë‚Äçüíª
RESOURCES & TOOLS
LONGSTORIES (TOOL) [10]
LongStories.ai lets creators build ‚ÄúUniverses‚Äù, reusable video templates with set characters, voices, style, and settings. Once built, creators can generate unlimited long-form AI videos from simple prompts. This eliminates repeated setup and keeps videos consistent. The platform allows creators to scale production for YouTube and other platforms.
RIVERSIDE (TOOL) [11]
Riverside lets users record, edit, livestream, host, and publish studio-quality audio and video. It includes multi-track 4K recording, AI editing, and automated promotional assets. Users can create podcasts, webinars, social clips, stream live in HD, and publish to YouTube, Spotify, and Apple.
üéÅ
MISCELLANEOUS
GOOGLE'S AI OVERVIEW HAS BEEN SENDING ME THE WRONG CUSTOMERS FOR 6 MONTHS (2 MINUTE READ) [12]
For 6 months, a company received angry refund requests from people who were not customers because Google's AI Overview repeatedly showed the wrong support email for a similarly named business. The issue was not a system bug but an AI hallucination that misdirected searchers, sending hundreds of frustrated users to the wrong company. The practical solution is to actively monitor Google AI Overviews for brand-related searches, downvote incorrect summaries, and test results across regions using a VPN. AI Overviews vary by country and may be correct in some territories.
WHY INTERNAL COMMS SHOULD REPORT IN TO MARKETING (7 MINUTE READ) [13]
Internal communications (IC) should report in to marketing because employees are a core brand audience, and the internal experience must align with the external brand. Marketing brings the skills IC needs to succeed. Housing IC in marketing turns it from an administrative function into a strategic one. It improves alignment with launches and priorities, and creates more scalable employee communications while still maintaining close ties to HR and leadership.
‚ö°
QUICK LINKS
10 CONTENT MARKETING TIPS (2 MINUTE READ) [14]
Great content marketers lead with narrative, build a media-first ecosystem, and measure impact beyond clicks.
CONTENT MARKETER VS. MANAGER VS. STRATEGIST (1 MINUTE READ) [15]
Roles, responsibilities, and pay expectations of content strategists, content marketers, and content marketing managers to reduce confusion.
HOW TO CHOOSE WHICH PROBLEMS TO SOLVE AS A PMM (1 MINUTE READ) [16]
A four-quadrant filter to delegate low-impact work, quick wins, shared wins, and strategic levers.

item.title: Meta seeks to bar mentions of mental health from child safety trial
item.description:
PLUS: Join our livestream today.

View in browser  |  Your newsletter preferences

01.21.26

 
 

BUSINESS

Meta Seeks to Bar Mentions of Mental Health‚Äîand Zuckerberg‚Äôs Harvard Past‚ÄîFrom Child Safety Trial

BY LAUREN GOODE | 5-MINUTE READ

The trial starts soon in New Mexico‚Äôs case against Meta‚Äîand the company is pulling out all the stops to protect its reputation.

 
 

SECURITY

ICE Details a New Minnesota-Based Detention Network That Spans 5 States

BY DELL CAMERON | 2-MINUTE READ

Internal ICE planning documents propose spending up to $50 million on a privately run network capable of shipping immigrants in custody hundreds of miles across the Upper Midwest.

 
 

THE BIG STORY

‚ÄòI‚Äôm Witnessing a Lot of Emptiness‚Äô: How ICE Uprooted Normal Life in Minneapolis

BY LINA MISITZIS AND KATIE THORNTON | 17-MINUTE READ

WIRED talks to a postal worker, a teacher, two US citizens detained by federal agents, and six more Minnesota residents about life in an occupied American city.

 

IN CASE YOU MISSED IT

Your First Humanoid Robot Coworker Will Probably Be Chinese

BY WILL KNIGHT | 8-MINUTE READ

Explosive acceleration, limited dexterity, eyes in the back of its head. What could possibly go wrong?

‚úö Join us today: Discuss China‚Äôs dominance, influence, and how it is rewriting the future at our livestream AMA

 

ADVERTISEMENT

 

UNCANNY VALLEY

Jimmy Wales Will Never Edit Donald Trump‚Äôs Wikipedia Page: He ‚ÄòMakes Me Insane‚Äô

BY KATIE DRUMMOND 

On this week‚Äôs episode of The Big Interview podcast, Wikipedia founder Jimmy Wales talks about maintaining neutrality in an online ecosystem increasingly hostile to facts.

 ‚ñ∫ LISTEN NOW 

 
 

SCIENCE

The AI Boom Will Increase US Carbon Emissions‚Äîbut It Doesn‚Äôt Have To

BY MOLLY TAFT | 6-MINUTE READ

A new analysis finds that data centers‚Äô energy demands will drastically increase power plant emissions over the next decade. Renewables, though, could cut them while helping keep prices from rising.

 
 

SCIENCE

‚ÄòVeronika‚Äô Is the First Cow Known to Use a Tool

BY JORGE GARAY | 2-MINUTE READ

This is the first recorded instance of a bovine using tools from her environment to relieve an itch‚Äîleaving scientists astonished.

 
 

GEAR

Are DJI Drones Still Banned?

BY SCOTT GILBERTSON | 3-MINUTE READ

Can you still buy a DJI drone in the US? (Yes.) Will you be able to buy future drones? (Maybe.) Here are the current drone dos and don‚Äôts.

 
 

DEAL OF THE DAY

This Unique Air Fryer Cooks Your Food in Heatproof Glass‚ÄîIt‚Äôs on Sale Right Now

BY BRAD BOURQUE | 1-MINUTE READ

Ninja turns the air fryer on its head with the semi-portable Crispi.

item.title: Microsoft OpenAI docs leak üìÑ, X open sources algo üë®‚Äçüíª, MCP vs Skills vs Agents ü§ñ
item.description:
Elon Musk's lawsuit against OpenAI has unveiled over 200 documents that offer an inside look into the relationship between OpenAI and Microsoft¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†
Sign Up [1] |Advertise [2]|View Online [3]
TLDR
TOGETHER WITH [Microsoft Azure] [4]
TLDR 2026-01-21
FEEL LIKE YOUR TABS HAVE TABS? (SPONSOR) [4]
Developer tool sprawl is real. You've got one tab for logs, another for metrics, half a dozen for cloud services, and somewhere in there is the code you're actually trying to ship.
ü´£ Stop playing hide-and-seek with your tools. Microsoft Azure [4] brings together everything you need to build and run software in a single workspace.
Goodbye, hunting for the right dashboard. Hello, one unified view‚Äîand a faster path to innovation.
Simplify your stack with Azure ‚Üí [4]
üì±
BIG TECH & STARTUPS
THE MICROSOFT-OPENAI FILES: INTERNAL DOCUMENTS REVEAL THE REALITIES OF AI'S DEFINING ALLIANCE (27 MINUTE READ) [5]
Elon Musk's lawsuit accusing OpenAI and its CEO Sam Altman of abandoning the nonprofit mission has unveiled over 200 documents that offer an inside look into the relationship between OpenAI and Microsoft. Musk, an OpenAI co-founder, is seeking up to $134 billion in damages, with a jury trial scheduled for this Spring. The files reveal how Microsoft pursued, rebuffed, and backed OpenAI at various moments over the past decade. The previously undisclosed emails, messages, slide decks, reports, and deposition transcripts show how Microsoft ultimately shaped the course of the lab that launched the generative AI era.
X OPEN SOURCES ITS ALGORITHM WHILE FACING A TRANSPARENCY FINE AND GROK CONTROVERSIES (6 MINUTE READ) [6]
X has open sourced its algorithm, giving the world a peek behind the company's algorithmic curtain. The site's algorithm considers engagement history and surveys recent in-network posts when finding content for individual users. It conducts a machine-learning-based analysis of 'out of network' posts that it believes the user might also find appealing. The algorithm then filters out certain kinds of posts, as well as content deemed too violent or spam-like, and ranks the content based on what it thinks users will find most appealing.
üöÄ
SCIENCE & FUTURISTIC TECHNOLOGY
MODERNA, MERCK REPORT POSITIVE RESULTS FROM CANCER-VACCINE STUDY (1 MINUTE READ) [7]
In a Phase 2b trial, Moderna and Merck's cancer vaccine reduced the risk of relapse or death in melanoma patients by 49% when used in combination with Merck's immunotherapy Keytruda, compared to when using Keytruda alone. The results illustrate mRNA's potential in cancer care. The treatment continues to demonstrate sustained and clinically meaningful improvement. The companies are currently running eight Phase 2 and Phase 3 clinical trials across multiple tumor types.
THE FIRST COMMERCIAL SPACE STATION, HAVEN-1, IS NOW UNDERGOING ASSEMBLY FOR LAUNCH (14 MINUTE READ) [8]
The International Space Station is due to be decommissioned in less than five years, but NASA has yet to formally publish rules and requirements for a potential replacement. There are currently four main contenders for NASA's commercial space station program: Voyager Technologies, Axiom Space, Blue Origin, and Vast Space. NASA is expected to select one or two of these companies for contracts later this year. This article contains an interview with Vast's chief executive, Max Haot. Vast is currently building a smaller interim space station capable of short-duration stays called Haven-1.
üíª
PROGRAMMING, DESIGN & DATA SCIENCE
üìä HOW MANY DASHBOARDS IS TOO MANY?¬†(SPONSOR) [9]
Every new monitoring tool, service, or "quick integration" adds another dashboard to the pile‚Äîand before you know it, you're spending more time switching between tools than actually building. With Microsoft Azure [10], your entire stack lives in one workspace: infrastructure, data, AI, and more. See how Azure brings it all together ‚Üí [10]
MCP, SKILLS, AND AGENTS (10 MINUTE READ) [11]
Harnesses are constantly improving by iterating on what works well. However, every time someone releases a new behavior, the thought leaders of the internet determine that it has replaced all previous functionality. Developers should try both skills and MCP to learn the fundamentals of how the technology works and what that means for managing the context window. How the technologies shift in the future depends entirely on the workflows they help people solve.
SKILLS.SH (WEBSITE) [12]
Skills are reusable capabilities for AI agents. This site contains an open agent skills ecosystem with a collection of skills anyone can install with a single command to enhance their agents with access to procedural knowledge. The site contains thousands of skills. The index is searchable and shows how many times each skill has been installed.
üéÅ
MISCELLANEOUS
I'M ADDICTED TO BEING USEFUL (5 MINUTE READ) [13]
People think software engineers are addicted to being useful, driven by an addiction to solving puzzles, or drawn by power and money. What actually motivates software engineers is often more of an internal compulsion. It's worth figuring out what really motivates you so that you can harness that compulsion most effectively.
AGENTIC AI AND THE MYTHICAL AGENT-MONTH (6 MINUTE READ) [14]
The concept of 'Scalable Agency', where a developer could theoretically spin up thousands of agents to complete tasks faster, relies on a flawed assumption that software engineering is an embarrassingly parallel task. Context loading is not the same as common knowledge, and reading tokens is not the same as understanding the causal chain of changes across a system. Adding manpower to a late software project makes it later. Multi-agent systems do not escape this law, they simply hit the wall of state-space explosion faster than humans do.
‚ö°
QUICK LINKS
TLDR IS HIRING A SENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER, APPLIED AI ($200K-$300K, FULLY REMOTE) [15]
As the first engineer on TLDR's new Applied AI team, you'll build AI agents and composable Claude Skills to let non-technical teammates create their own AI workflows.¬†Learn more [16].
SYNTUX (GITHUB REPO) [17]
syntux is a generative UI library that is consistent and flexible.
THE TRAGEDY OF THE AGENTIC COMMONS (18 MINUTE READ) [18]
AI agents help facilitate better match quality through centralized mechanisms in 'thin' markets.
THE MICROSTRUCTURE OF WEALTH TRANSFER IN PREDICTION MARKETS (26 MINUTE READ) [19]
Prediction markets are creating a systematic wealth transfer, where impulsive Takers pay a structural premium for affirmative outcomes while Makers capture an 'Optimism Tax' simply by selling into this biased flow.
SOFTWARE AS CLAY ON THE WHEEL (6 MINUTE READ) [20]
Just like when working with clay, when software doesn't work, you throw it back, refine it, and spin again until it's right.
NETFLIX TO PAY ALL CASH FOR WARNER BROS. TO FEND OFF PARAMOUNT HOSTILE TAKEOVER (8 MINUTE READ) [21]
Netflix originally planned to buy each Warner Bros. share with $23.25 in cash and $4.50 in Netflix stock, but it has amended the deal to sweeten the offer for shareholders.
PIPENET (WEBSITE) [22]
pipenet is an alternative to localtunnel that bundles client and server to host self-hosted tunnel infrastructure for full control over security, domains, and availability.

item.title: üåé AI's top minds converge at World Economic Forum
item.description:
^**[Read Online](https://www.therundown.ai/p/ai-takes-center-stage-at-davos?_bhlid=4eaa234680798ad3bdb45514b5705f029891f88c&jwt_token=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJzdWJzY3JpYmVyX2lkIjoiZTQyMjNjMTUtMTU3Ni00NmY2LTljMDAtZjA3YWVhMmY5YjgwIiwicHVibGljYXRpb25faWQiOiI0ZDAzMzkwZC0yNDgxLTQyOTktYjk0OS1mZmQ4YjM4YjRjMzgiLCJhY2Nlc3NfdHlwZSI6InJlYWQtb25seSIsImV4cCI6MTc2OTE2MjU4MiwiaXNzIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly9hcHAuYmVlaGlpdi5jb20iLCJpYXQiOjE3Njg5ODk3ODJ9.3_-GKER7_5MDnApftK1wR2NE6FhCoqBLNMdcUDxGKno)**^^ | ^^**[Sign Up](https://www.therundown.ai/subscribe)**^^ | ^^**[Advertise](https://therundownai.typeform.com/to/kraZ1TSO)**^
---------- View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/e421b863-cb0d-4a77-b88f-bd5ca2d3eae0/mongodb.jpg?t=1768941099) Follow image link: (https://www.mongodb.com/solutions/startups?utm_source=fnf&utm_medium=Newsletter&utm_campaign=mongodb-rtb-january&utm_term=the-rundown&utm_content=startups-partners) Caption:
----------
---------- **Good morning, vibex.** The world's elite converged on Davos this week for the World Economic Forum, and there was one topic on everyone's minds ‚Äî AI.
The takeaway from the industry's top leaders? Disruption is coming faster than expected, and the window for both individuals and companies to adapt is closing fast.
**_P.S.:_**_ We are sitting down for a Q&A with Jeetu Patel, President and Chief Product Officer at Cisco, and want our community to participate in the action! Submit any AI questions on the industry, security, future predictions, company workflows, etc., _[_here_](https://link.therundown.ai/zadWnn)_. _
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
**In today‚Äôs AI rundown:**
* AI takes center stage at WEF in Davos
* 'Human-centric' AI startup raises $480M
* Get better AI outputs using multiple choice
* LTX launches audio-to-video generation
* 4 new AI tools, community workflows, and more
----------
---------- **LATEST DEVELOPMENTS**
----------
---------- ###### AI & THE WORLD ECONOMIC FORUM
#### üåé _**[AI takes center stage at WEF in Davos](https://www.weforum.org/)**_
View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/23b1cc41-5583-47cc-ad85-45cbeb7b05ff/davos2026.jpg?t=1768946977) Caption: Image source: WEF / The Rundown
**The Rundown: **The World Economic Forum [kicked off](https://www.weforum.org/) this week in Davos, featuring an intense focus on AI that included discussions with the industry‚Äôs top minds, including Anthropic‚Äôs Dario Amodei, Google‚Äôs Demis Hassabis, and Microsoft‚Äôs Satya Nadella.
**The details: **
* Amodei took a [shot](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ckt1cj0xjRM) at U.S. President Donald Trump‚Äôs recent policy allowing AI chip sales to China, likening it to ‚Äúselling nuclear weapons to North Korea‚Äù.
* Hassabis [believes](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mmKAnHz36v0&t=3s) this year could see AI-driven slowdowns in junior hiring, but that AI tools could ultimately enable more skill creation than traditional paths.
* Nadella [said](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NLsoEJ7WpZY) no company can ‚Äújust coast‚Äù in the AI era, stating that big companies that don‚Äôt keep up will ‚Äúget schooled by someone small.‚Äù
* Amodei also said we may be just 6-12 months away from models that do ‚Äúmost, maybe all‚Äù of what software engineers do end-to-end.
**Why it matters: **Davos talks often stay abstract, but Amodei's timeline for full AI-powered coding puts a tight deadline on the disruption we're already seeing with tools like Claude Code. Between geopolitical warnings, labor shifts, and software upheaval, the message from AI's leaders is clear: the window to adapt is shrinking rapidly.
----------
---------- ###### TOGETHER WITH MONGODB
#### üìà [_**Startup support that delivers results**_](https://www.mongodb.com/solutions/startups?utm_source=fnf&utm_medium=Newsletter&utm_campaign=mongodb-rtb-january&utm_term=the-rundown&utm_content=startups-partners)
View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/8ceba5f5-a4df-474e-83a7-095c78ead4a1/image2__33_.png?t=1768941052) Follow image link: (https://www.mongodb.com/solutions/startups?utm_source=fnf&utm_medium=Newsletter&utm_campaign=mongodb-rtb-january&utm_term=the-rundown&utm_content=startups-partners) Caption:
**The Rundown:** Let MongoDB for Startups partner with you as you build the next big thing with the tools, support, and go-to-market opportunities you need to accelerate from idea to IPO.
**MongoDB for Startups includes:**
* Built-in vector search using VoyageAI
* Real-time data streaming
* Baseline credits and technical expertise
_[Get started today for free](https://www.mongodb.com/solutions/startups?utm_source=fnf&utm_medium=Newsletter&utm_campaign=mongodb-rtb-january&utm_term=the-rundown&utm_content=startups-partners)_.
----------
---------- ###### HUMANS&
#### ü§ù **[_'Human-centric' AI startup raises $480M_](https://humansand.ai/)**
View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/a9fb9a46-45b1-4292-b432-f4991e324f6e/humansand.jpg?t=1768943423) Caption: Image source: Humans&
**The Rundown: **A new AI startup founded by researchers from Anthropic, xAI, and Google, just [raised](https://humansand.ai/) $480M in seed funding at a $4.48B valuation, pushing to build AI that helps people collaborate better over automation and full replacement.
**The details:**
* Humans& aims to build AI that functions like an intelligent group chat, requesting context, storing memory, and coordinating teams.
* Co-founder Andi Peng left Anthropic over its autonomy focus, saying they ‚Äúloved to highlight how its models churned for 8, 24, 50 hours by themselves."
* The team includes Google's seventh employee, Georges Harik, two former xAI researchers who worked on Grok, and Stanford professor Noah Goodman.
* The $480M seed round was led by SV Angel and its co-founder Harik, alongside Nvidia, Jeff Bezos, and Google Ventures.
**Why it matters: **A $4.48B value for a 3-month old startup is wild, but shows the investor appetite for any team with a frontier lab pedigree. The "human-centric" angle is a shot at the autonomy-driven gains most labs are chasing, though we‚Äôve seen similar framing from the likes of Microsoft AI (and even Anthropic in its own ads).
----------
---------- ###### AI TRAINING
#### üìù **_[Get better AI outputs using multiple choice](https://app.therundown.ai/guides/get-better-ai-outputs-with-this-multiple-choice-technique)_**
View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/ddee6b4a-0e11-4f12-95bf-08cf3acf916b/021_banner.jpeg?t=1768941294) Caption:
**The Rundown: **In this tutorial, you will learn a universal strategy to get better outputs from any AI model at a fraction of the cost by minimizing the amount of unhelpful context you add to the AI‚Äôs ‚Äúbrain‚Äù.
**Step-by-step:**
1. Open any chat-based AI and break your idea into Goal, Task, and Next Steps to "minimize unhelpful messages". The task will be to interview to build context
2. Prompt using the Goal‚ÜíTask‚ÜíNext Steps pattern, e.g.: _"Your job is to generate a logo... Interview me with 5-10 MCQs about my brand, vision to build context"_
3. Respond to Qs with simple choices (e.g., ‚ÄúA, B, A, C‚Ä¶‚Äù). This removes miscommunication and ensures that the AI has a better understanding
4. Once it generates concepts, prompt to _"Generate a 4x4 grid with each concept in a separate grid cell"_ to save on tokens, then ask for standalone images
**Pro tip:** If you get great results from this method, export and re-use the context by asking the AI to "extract the context as system instructions in markdown.‚Äù
----------
---------- ###### PRESENTED BY MAULT
#### üíª **[_The real-time governance layer for AI-generated code_](https://link.therundown.ai/JR50VY)**
View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/ddf2d6c9-49b6-480e-9cc6-a18374b5fcc3/Copy_of_Copy_of_Black_Purple_Simple_Tech_Carousel_Instagram_Post__1280_x_720_px___1_.jpeg?t=1768941170) Follow image link: (https://link.therundown.ai/JR50VY) Caption:
**The Rundown**: Mault is a VS Code extension that applies real-time architectural guardrails to prevent drift as code is generated.
**Unlike linters or CI checks, Mault operates at the point of change:**
* Detects structural and config mismatches
* Enforces file structure and naming
* Flags deprecated or unsafe dependencies
* Works alongside AI coding tools
_[Click here to download the extension](https://link.therundown.ai/JR50VY)_.
----------
---------- ###### LIGHTRICKS
#### üéµ **[_LTX launches audio-to-video generation_](https://x.com/LTXStudio/status/2013650214171877852?s=20)**
View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/bd5f057d-f4f7-4bc2-b938-f3ca1d1257e0/ltx-audiovideo.jpg?t=1768949581) Caption: Image source: LTX
**The Rundown: **AI creative platform Lightricks just [released](https://x.com/LTXStudio/status/2013650214171877852?s=20) a new Audio-to-Video feature, allowing users to start with voice, music, or sound effects and then generate the video output to accompany it.
**The details: **
* The tool syncs motion, lip movements, and camera work directly to the uploaded audio, keeping consistency across generations.
* Users can upload files, record directly, or use a built-in text-to-speech tool powered by ElevenLabs‚Äô Scribe V2 model.
* LTX said the model can understand rhythm and beat, making it capable of music videos and timing/pacing outputs to align with audio.
* LTX called being able to start from audio ‚Äúthe third paradigm in AI video generation,‚Äù allowing for more consistent and natural outputs.
**Why it matters: **Starting with sound opens up brand new creative pathways ‚Äî with the ability to build around existing audio assets rather than roughly fitting dialogue onto AI-generated clips. While AI video has already hit such a high bar, tools enabling consistency and customization are the next lever to take models to new heights.
----------
---------- **QUICK HITS**
----------
---------- ### üõ†Ô∏è _**[Trending AI Tools](https://www.rundown.ai/tools)**_
* üí° [Skills](https://link.therundown.ai/OTKxt0) - Vercel‚Äôs open ecosystem for finding and sharing agentic skills
* üé• [LTX Audio to Video](https://x.com/LTXStudio/status/2013650214171877852?s=20) - Generate videos directly from audio inputs
* üëÅÔ∏è [Step3-VL-10B](https://www.rundown.ai/tools/step3-vl-10b) - StepFun‚Äôs open-source SOTA vision language model
* üí¶ [LFM2.5-1.2B-Thinking](https://x.com/liquidai/status/2013633347625324627?s=20) - Liquid AI‚Äôs new on-device reasoning model
----------
---------- ### üì∞ **_[Everything else in AI today](https://www.rundown.ai/)_**
**OpenAI‚Äôs Chris Lehane** [revealed](https://link.therundown.ai/xCTaPN) during a talk at Davos that the company is ‚Äúon track‚Äù to unveil its Jony Ive-led physical AI device in the second half of 2026.
**Node.js creator Ryan Dahl** [declared](https://x.com/rough__sea/status/2013280952370573666) the era of humans writing code over, arguing that software engineers still have work, but writing syntax directly is no longer the job.
**Liquid AI **[released](https://huggingface.co/LiquidAI/LFM2.5-1.2B-Thinking) LFM2.5-1.2B-Thinking, a reasoning variant small enough to run on smartphones while matching larger rivals on math and problem-solving benchmarks.
**OpenAI **[introduced](https://openai.com/index/our-approach-to-age-prediction/) a new age prediction feature on ChatGPT to help automatically apply underage-specific safeguards to younger users.
**AI inference company Baseten** is [raising](https://www.wsj.com/tech/ai/nvidia-invests-150-million-in-ai-inference-startup-baseten-fe7ede72?gaa_at=eafs&gaa_n=AWEtsqeR3sqYhw5a0FcdRiyhPR-60zeYIk0nKVlyKC7xgStbfBv0fmQ5AnPcSVbEQw%3D%3D&gaa_ts=696ff05d&gaa_sig=MZMKUgIAJ_yn0AF06F3cgPlzfzBoTZT7JrpU4DLoF7osdX8FfLnt7MKOG2euclAeccbEsGGjYmNZr_ZJVdoLkQ%3D%3D) $300M in funding, with half coming from an investment by Nvidia, valuing the startup at $5B.
**Anthropic **[announced](https://www.anthropic.com/news/anthropic-teach-for-all) a new partnership with Teach For All to train more than 100k educators across 63 countries on AI tools for the classroom.
----------
---------- **COMMUNITY**
----------
---------- ### ü§ù _**[Community AI workflows](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfH4UPzu72HTpdb08Qlm-0dLwKJIjdcAwCcAvVywcHD6mwKig/viewform)**_
Every newsletter, we showcase how a reader is using AI to work smarter, save time, or make life easier.
Today‚Äôs workflow comes from reader **Matt R.** in London, UK:
"I was making my annual family calendar and found that a number of my wife's Apple photos were in HEIC format, which weren't accepted by Snapfish. I looked for a file converter to get them into JPGs, and was quickly browsing the spate of 'free' options that don't tell you that to convert more than one file, you have to hand over your credit card.
I asked Mocha to build me a HEIC to JPG converter, and 5 minutes later, it was ready and operational!"
How do you use AI? Tell us [here](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfH4UPzu72HTpdb08Qlm-0dLwKJIjdcAwCcAvVywcHD6mwKig/viewform).
----------
---------- ### **üéì **_**[Highlights: News, Guides & Events](https://app.therundown.ai/)**_
* Read our last AI newsletter: [Claude Code sparks AI ‚Äòselfware‚Äô era](https://www.rundown.ai/articles/claude-code-sparks-selfware-era)
* Read our last Tech newsletter: [Biotech‚Äôs big 3 (and they‚Äôre wild)](https://www.rundown.ai/articles/biotechs-big-3-and-they-re-wild)
* Read our last Robotics newsletter: [1X now has a world model](https://www.rundown.ai/articles/1x-now-has-a-world-model)
* Today‚Äôs AI tool guide: [Get better AI outputs using multiple choice](https://app.therundown.ai/guides/get-better-ai-outputs-with-this-multiple-choice-technique)
* RSVP to next workshop @ 4PM EST Thursday: [AI Foundations Bootcamp pt.3](https://app.therundown.ai/calendar-events/695aad31c08489e266340b78)
----------
---------- See you soon,
_Rowan, Joey, Zach, Shubham, and Jennifer ‚Äî the humans behind The Rundown_
